lines.value: he called on the people to support the king of spain against the rebellious viceroy of mexico

lines.value: after he died several other people such as vicente guerrero kept fighting against the spanish until 1821 when mexico became an independent country

lines.value: the shinkansen 新幹線 is a group of high speed railway lines in japan upon which the famous bullet trains run
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the shinkansen are run by the many jr companies
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the past japan railway was called japanese national railways it is now one group of private companies
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: jr also run commuter trains and inter city trains around tokyo
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the name bullet train is the english translation of the japanese word dangan ressha 弾丸列車 which was the name given to the project while it was being made in the 1940s
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: nowadays the trains are called shinkansen trains
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the name shinkansen means new trunk line
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the trains are called super expresses
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: japan was the first country to build railway lines for high speed travel
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: because japan has many mountains the network that already existed was made of 3'6 gauge 1067 mm narrow gauge lines which tended to take non direct routes and could not be adapted to higher speeds
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: because of this japan had a greater need for new high speed lines than countries where the existing standard gauge or broad gauge rail system could be upgraded easily
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: unlike the older lines shinkansen lines are standard gauge and use tunnels and viaducts to go through and over obstacles rather than around them.construction of the first section of the tokaido shinkansen between tokyo and osaka started in 1959
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the line opened on october 1 1964 just in time for the tokyo olympics
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the line was an immediate success reaching the 100 million passenger mark in less than three years on july 13 1967 and one billion passengers in 1976
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the first shinkansen trains ran at speeds of up to 200 km h 125 mph later increased to 220 km h 135 mph
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some of these trains with their classic bullet nosed appearance are still in use for stopping services between hakata and osaka
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a driving car from one of the original trains is now in the british national railway museum in york
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many more advanced models of train followed the first type generally each with its own distinctive appearance
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: shinkansen trains now run regularly at speeds of up to 300 km h 185 mph putting them among the fastest trains running in the world along with the french tgv and german ice trains
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: originally meant to carry passenger and freight trains by day and night the shinkansen lines carry only passenger trains
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the system shuts down between midnight and 6:00 every day to allow maintenance to take place including the running of doctor yellow test trains
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the few overnight trains that still run in japan run on the old narrow gauge network which the shinkansen runs parallel to.in 2003 jr tokai reported that the shinkansen's average arrival time was within 6 seconds of the scheduled time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this includes all natural and human accidents and errors and is calculated from about 160000 trips shinkansen made
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the previous record was from 1997 and was 18 seconds
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the first derailment of a shinkansen train in passenger service occurred during the chuetsu earthquake on october 23 2004
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: 6 of the total of 8 cars of the train on the joetsu shinkansen derailed near nagaoka station in nagaoka niigata
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in recent years due to noise pollution increasing speed is getting harder
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: thus the current research is aimed to reduce the amount of noise mainly when trains exit a tunnel
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: three extensions are under construction for opening by 2014-2018 nagano kanazawa aomori hakodate and takeo onsen isahaya
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the first ever shinkansen line built in 1964 travelled at 125mph and was called the tokaido shinkansen
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1972 a second one was developed and the improvements on infrastructure allowed it to travel at around 137mph
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 2003 the japanese built the world's fastest ever shinkansen with a top speed of 361mph
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: * east meets west a story of how the shinkansen brought tokyo and osaka closer together
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: texas hold'em is a popular version of the card game poker
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: before any cards are dealt two players to the left of the dealer make bets which are called the small blind and big blind
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these forced bets must be at least matched by the other players in order to keep their hands
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the big blind is twice as much as the small blind
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if the big blind was $1000 then it is said that the blinds are 500 and 1000
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this money is put into a place in the center of the table that is called the pot each player is given two cards face down
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these are called the player's hole cards or what the player has in the hole
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: once all the players have their hole cards the betting starts
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the player to the left of the big blind player starts the betting
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the lowest amount that can be bet is the amount of the big blind
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: players can bet more than the minimum
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is called raising
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the amount a player can raise is determined by the type of the game being played see below if a player raises the amount he raised the bet to is the new minimum
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: each player in turn may either call pay the current bet amount raise or fold quit the hand
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this action keeps going around the table until each player has called or folded his hand
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after the first turn of betting is over the dealer lays three cards face up on the table
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is called the flop
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these three cards are community cards
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this means they are used by every player in the game along with the two hole cards each player has
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after the flop another turn of betting takes place
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there is no starting bet in this turn no blinds unless a player makes a bet
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: players may check or bet nothing if no player before them in the turn has bet
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if everyone checks or if a player bets and all the others call or fold then the round of betting is over
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: next the dealer lays another community card face up
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this card is called the turn or 4th street
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: another series of betting comes after this
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this betting is the same as after the flop
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: finally the dealer lays the last community card known as the river or 5th street
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this card is again followed by a turn of betting calling and folding by the players
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: with the five community cards and their two hole cards each player makes the best 5 card poker hand he can
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the player with the best poker hand wins the round and the pot
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if two or more players have the same hand those players split the pot evenly
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if one person bets and all other players have folded the hand ends then and that player wins
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: texas hold'em can be played several ways including limit pot limit and no limit games
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the version of the game usually is the maximum a player can raise at any one time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: limit games have a set amount that a player can raise at any time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if a game has a $10 limit then a raise must be exactly $10
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if more than one person raises each one can only raise $10 more than the last raise
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: typically there is a cap of 3 raises per round
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: also when playing limit the bet and raise amount will usually double for the turn and river betting rounds
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in a 4 player game player a bets $10
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: player b raises $10 puts in $20 total player c calls player b puts in $20
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: player d at this point can either fold pay $20 call player b or raise $10 to a total of $30
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: player a would go next and either call paying the difference between his $10 bet and the current bet
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this would continue until all players either call or fold
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in pot limit games the most a player can bet or raise is the total amount in the pot
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: with each bet or raise the amount in the pot gets larger
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this allows for larger raises
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in spread limit games there is both a minimum and a maximum raise specified
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for example one could play $5-$50 spread limit
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the big blind would be $5 and the minimum raise would be $5 and the maximum raise would be $50
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in no limit there is not a limit of how much can be bet at any time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: that is it is just like spread limit but with no maximum
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a player can bet up to all money as he has
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if a player bets all of his money he is said to be all in
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if a player bets more money than another player has the second player can call by going all in
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if only those two players stay in the hand all other players fold the first player takes back any money that is over the amount the player going all in has
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at this point all betting stops and the dealer deals out the rest of the cards
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if a player goes all in and two or more players are still betting the other betters can raise each other until they both call or one of them also goes all in
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a side pot is made in this case
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is the difference between the final bet and the first person's all in
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: only the two players were not all in can win this pot
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if the all in player wins the hand he wins the main pot his money plus an equal amount from each other player and which ever of the other two players had the better hand wins the side pot
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in an eight player game it is possible to have several side pots with several people being all in at the same time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if there are not two player left who can bet betting stops and all players turn their hands over
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: player a bets $5000
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: player b only has $3000
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he goes all in
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: player c raises $2000 puts in a total of $7000
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: player a calls puts in $2000
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at this point the main pot is worth $9000 $3000 from each player
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the side pot is worth $8000 $7000 - $3000 from players a and c if player a or c wins he wins both the main pot and the side pot $17000 and player b is out of the game since he is out of money
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if player b wins he wins the main pot and the side pot goes to which ever player has the best hand between players a and c
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: tournaments are what people often see when poker is shown on television
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when a player enters a tournament he pays an entry fee called the buy in most of his buy in is placed with other player's money in the prize pool
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: usually a small portion of the buy in is kept by the tournament officials for their expenses and profit
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the player is given a table and seat assignment and a certain number of chips the same amount as every other player
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: unlike normal chips these tournament chips have no cash value though they often are referred to with dollar amounts
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: players must continue to play until they run out of chips
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the tournament continues until one player has accumulated all of the chips
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the order in which people lose all their chips or bust out is their finishing order
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: that is the last player to bust out is the second place finisher
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the prize pool is divided amongst a fraction of the top finishers usually about 10%
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the first place winner usually gets a much larger share with the prizes diminishing until the prize pool is empty
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the player who was the last player to finish without winning any prize is said to have finished on the bubble as players bust out of the tournament the average player's chip stack gets larger
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in order to insure that the blinds do not become insignificant in the face of the growth in chip stacks tournaments are played in timed rounds at the beginning of each round typically the blinds increase
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: every few rounds there will be a short break between rounds
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for tournaments that last longer than a day there will be a last level for the day and the tournament will resume the next day
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most tournaments only allow a player to buy in and receive chips once at the beginning
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these are called freeze out tournaments
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some tournaments allow players to buy in more than once for the first few levels of the tournament
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these players are said to re buy and the money they use to rebuy goes into the prize pool with the rest of the buy ins
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: afrikaans is a west germanic language mainly spoken in south africa and namibia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was originally the dialect that developed among the afrikaner protestant settlers the unfree workers and slaves brought to the cape area in southwestern south africa by the dutch east india company ( voc between 1652 and 1705
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most of these first settlers were from the united provinces now netherlands though there were also many from germany some from france a few from scotland and various other countries
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the unfree workers and slaves were malays and malagasy in addition to the native khoi and bushmen
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: research by j a heese says that until 1807 36.8% of the ancestors of the white afrikaans speaking population were dutch 35% were german 14.6% were french and 7.2% non white of african and or asian origins
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: heese's figures are questioned by other researchers however and especially the non white component quoted by heese is very much in doubt
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a sizeable minority of those who spoke afrikaans as a first language were not white
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the dialect became known as cape dutch
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: later afrikaans was sometimes called african dutch or kitchen dutch
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: afrikaans was considered a dutch dialect until the early 20th century when it began to be widely known as a different language
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the name afrikaans is simply the dutch word for african and the language is the african form of dutch
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the eucharist also called holy communion the sacrament or the lord's supper is a kind of religious ritual in many christian churches
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it started when jesus christ told his followers to eat bread and drink wine in memory of him at the last supper
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: according to the roman catholic church the eucharist is the true presence of jesus christ the son of god
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: during a mass through the act of transubstantiation the bread and wine offered change and are no longer bread and wine
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they become the body and blood of jesus christ
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the bread and wine do not change appearance but they are the body and blood of jesus christ which catholics in good standing not in the state of mortal sin come and receive christ they consume him
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this follows what was said by christ eat my body and drink my blood john ch.6
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most protestant denominations believe that this was meant as a symbol while the catholic church bases its beliefs on the tradition handed down through the church
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: first century st ignatius of antioch disciple of the beloved disciple john in speaking of the heretics plaguing the church in their day wrote they abstain from the eucharist because they do not confess that the eucharist is the flesh of our savior jesus christ smyrnaeans 7).from the second century st justin martyr wrote this food we call eucharist which no one is allowed to share except the one who believes that our teaching is true and who has been washed with the washing that is for the remission of sins and unto regeneration and so lives as christ has handed down
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for we do not receive these as common bread and common drink but just as jesus christ our savior having been made flesh by the word of god had both flesh and blood for our salvation so likewise we have learned that the food over which thanks has been given by the prayer of the word which comes from him and by which our blood and flesh are nourished through a change is the flesh and blood of the same incarnate jesus the first apology
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in most protestant churches not including lutheranism the sacrament of communion involves eating small wafers or matzos and drinking wine or grape juice and not believing that it is the actual body and blood of jesus but as a very important symbolic observance and fulfillment of what christ commanded
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some churches offer it daily some weekly some monthly and some a few times a year
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: unlike the catholic teaching lutherans teach that the bread and wine is jesus body and blood but is bread and wine also consubstantiation
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the latter day saints or mormon church followers eat small pieces of bread and drink water
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they believe that this is a symbol of the body and blood of jesus and they call it the sacrament
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they also believe that it helps them to make the promises of baptism all over again
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: robert hooke frs isle of wight 18 july 1635 - london 3 march 1703 was an english naturalist architect and polymath
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: hooke played an important role in the birth of science in the 17th century with both experimental and theoretical work
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was a colleague of robert boyle and christopher wren and a rival to isaac newton
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: hooke was a leader in the plans to rebuild after the great fire of london in 1666
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he died of cuteness overload there is no surviving portrait of hooke
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he discovered hooke's law of elasticity
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he designed and ordered the making of telescopes and microscopes and used both instruments
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he reported on this work in a book called micrographia in 1665
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was the first person to see biological cells
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he made drawings of bodies in the solar system and made the first attempts to measure the distance of certain stars
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: robert hooke was appointed the royal society's first curator of experiments in 1662 and he rose to be secretary of the royal society
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he took responsibility for experiments performed at its weekly meetings
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this was a position he held for over 40 years
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1664 hooke also was appointed professor of geometry at gresham college in london and cutlerian lecturer in mechanics
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on 8 july 1680 hooke observed the nodal patterns associated with the mode of vibration of glass plates
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he ran a bow along the edge of a glass plate covered with flour and saw the nodal patterns emerge
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: p101 hooke did some fundamental work on gravitation and the motion of the planets
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: forever after he was convinced that newton and the world had cheated him of the credit p389
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was also known for his work in natural history biology and geology
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he reported on his microsope use in a book called micrographica in 1665
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was the first person to see biological cells and was the first to use the word cell to describe them
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1668 in a talk to the royal society he recognised that fossil shells of unknown marine animals suggested that some species had become extinct
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: hooke achieved fame in his day as surveyor to the city of london and chief assistant of christopher wren
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: hooke helped wren rebuild london after the great fire in 1666
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he also worked on the royal greenwich observatory and the infamous bethlem royal hospital which became known as bedlam
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many other buildings were designed by hooke including the royal college of physicians 1679
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: hooke's collaboration with christopher wren included st paul's cathedral whose dome uses a method of construction conceived by hooke
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: hooke also participated in the design of the pepys library which held the manuscripts of samuel pepys's diaries the most frequently cited eyewitness account of the great fire of london
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the reconstruction after the great fire hooke proposed redesigning london's streets on a grid pattern with wide boulevards and arteries a pattern later used in the renovation of paris liverpool and many american cities
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this proposal was thwarted by arguments over property rights as property owners were surreptitiously shifting their boundaries
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: hooke was in demand to settle many of these disputes due to his skill as a surveyor and his tact as an arbitrator
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the canary islands are a group of islands off the coast of morocco
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they are an autonomous community of spain they make their own laws
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are seven main islands
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the people who live there speak spanish
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the autonomous community has two capital cities of equal status santa cruz de tenerife and las palmas de gran canaria
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: like the other islands of macaronesia they were created by volcano es on the bottom of the sea

lines.value: a laser is a machine that makes an amplified single colour source of light
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the beam of light from the laser does not get wider or weaker as most sources of light do
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it uses special gases or crystals to make the light with only a single color
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: then mirrors are used to amplify make stronger that colour of light and to make all the light travel in one direction so it stays as a narrow beam sometimes called a collimated beam
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when pointed at something this narrow beam makes a single point of light
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: all of the energy of the light stays in that one narrow beam instead of spreading out like a flashlight electric torch
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the word laser is an acronym for light amplification by stimulated emission of radiation
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a laser creates light by special actions involving a material called an optical gain medium
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: energy is put into this material using an energy pump
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this can be electricity another light source or some other source of energy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the energy makes the material go into what is called an excited state
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this means the electrons in the material have extra energy and after a bit of time they will lose that energy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when they lose the energy they will release a photon a particle of light
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the type of optical gain medium used will change what color wavelength will be produced
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: releasing photons is the stimulated emission of radiation part of laser
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many things can radiate light like a light bulb but the light will not be organized in one direction and phase
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: by using an electric field to control how the light is created this light will now be one kind going in one direction
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is coherent radiation
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at this point the light is still weak
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the mirrors on either side bounce the light back and forth and this hits other parts of the optical gain medium causing those parts to also release photons generating more light light amplification
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when all of the optical gain medium is producing light this is called saturation and creates a very strong beam of light at a very narrow wavelength which we would call a laser beam
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the light moves through the medium between the two mirrors that reflect the light back and forth between them
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: one of the mirrors however only partially reflects the light allowing some to escape
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the escaping light makes up the laser beam
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is a simple design the type of optical gain medium used usually defines the type of laser
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it can be a crystal examples are ruby and a garnet crystal made of yttrium and aluminum with the rare earth metal mixed in
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: gases can be used for laser by using helium nitrogen carbon dioxide neon or others
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a free electron laser uses a beam of electrons
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: finally the smallest lasers use semiconductor diodes to produce the light
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these are used in electronics
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: albert einstein was the first to have the idea of stimulated emission that could produce a laser
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: from that point many years were spent to see if the idea worked
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at first people succeeded in making masers and later figured how to make shorter visible wavelengths
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was not until 1959 that the name laser was coined by gordon gould in a research paper
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the first working laser was put together and operated by theodore maiman at the hughes research laboratories in 1960
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many people started working on lasers at this time and the question of who would get the patent for the laser wasn't decided until 1987 gould won the rights
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: lasers have found many uses in everyday life as well as in industry
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: lasers are found in cd and dvd players where they read the code from the disk that stores a song or movie

lines.value: a laser is often used to read the bar codes or sqr codes on things sold in a store to identify a product and give its price

lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is used in chemistry with spectroscopy to identify materials to find out what kind of gases solids or liquids something is made of
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: stronger lasers can be used to cut metal
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a laser is even used to measure the distance of the moon from earth by reflecting off reflectors left by the apollo missions
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: by measuring the time it takes for the light to travel to the moon and back again we can find out exactly how far away the moon is

lines.value: multi cellular organisms are organisms with more than one cell
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is the case for animals plants and most fungi
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in such organisms cells are usually specialised
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: all the cells with the same function work together
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: such a group of cells is then called a tissue
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: multi cellular organisms have a set of cells that specialize in reproduction
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: reproduction in such organisms is usually sexual
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the sex cells are either sperm or ovum also named egg cells
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if they are sperm cells the organism is male if they are egg cells it is female
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if both are present the organism is a hermaphrodite
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: we know from their cell structure that multicellularity has evolved independently many times in earth history for example in plants and animals
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the earliest forms of life in the fossil record are cyanobacteria from the archaean era at 3.5 billion years ago
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they grew as single cells but lived in colonies as stromatolites
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the first multicellular fossils have been found in 2.1 billion years old palaeoproterozoic rocks from the gabon in africa
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these are eukaryotic cells which live colonially
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the fossils are visible to the naked eye and hence much larger than bacteria
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the authors comment that one advantage of multicellularity is larger size and that an adequate level of oxygen is required to support this kind of life
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: to reproduce multicellular organisms must solve the problem of regenerating a whole organism from germ cells i.e sperm and egg cells an issue that is studied in developmental biology
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: multicellular organisms especially long living animals also face the challenge of cancer which occurs when cells fail to regulate their growth within the normal program of development

lines.value: the berlin wall german berliner mauer was a wall that separated the city of berlin in germany from 1961 to 1989
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it separated the eastern half from the western half
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many people thought it was a symbol of the cold war
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the berlin wall was taken down on november 9 1989
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the berlin wall was about 168 km 104 miles long
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was built to prevent people from escaping from the eastern half of berlin
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after world war ii ended germany was divided into four zones one zone for each of the main allied countries france the united kingdom the united states and the soviet union
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: its capital berlin was also divided into four zones so that it was an enclave like an island inside the soviet zone
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in may 1949 the french united kingdom and us zones were made into west germany federal republic of germany bundesrepublik deutschland brd and west berlin
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the soviet zones were made into east germany and east berlin
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: east germany german democratic republic deutsche demokratische republik ddr was founded on october 7 1949
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: europe germany and berlin were divided by an iron curtain
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after germany split into west and east germany on may 81949 2.6 million east germans left to go to west germany
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in berlin alone 3.6 million people fled to the west
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: to stop this on august 13 1961 the communist government of east germany built a wall separating east and west berlin
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the wall was built to keep the country's people in
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: but the soviets and east german government said it was to keep capitalism out
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they said that west germany refused to recognize east germany as an independent country because they wanted to take over north east germany just like hitler took over poland
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: people still tried to escape even though the berlin wall was there
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they used many methods to get around the guards and barbed wire on the berlin wall
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the late 1980s mikhail gorbachev said that the soviet union would not use the red army to stop the people of eastern and middle europe from changing their government
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after he said that several countries began to change the way they governed their people
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: hungary opened its border and people from east germany began moving to the west through hungary
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in october 1989 mass demonstrations against the government in east germany began
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the long time leader erich honecker resigned and was replaced by egon krenz a few days later
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: honecker had predicted in january 1989 that the wall would stand for a hundred more years if the conditions which had caused its construction did not change
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this did not turn out to be true
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in november 1989 the central committee of east germany decided to make it easier for east germans to pass through the wall
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a mistake by the press officer meant the border was opened several hours before it should have been
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: millions of east german citizens celebrated the opening of the wall
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many collected souvenirs with chisels and some television stations filmed people hitting the wall with sledge hammers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this image of people in west berlin hitting the wall is often said to be east berliners breaking out
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is not true
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the eastern side of the wall had no graffiti on it

lines.value: all pictures of people chipping away at the wall show people hitting graffiti covered walls
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: less than one year after the berlin wall was broken down germany again became one country
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the 28 years of its existence between 125 and 206 people were killed when trying to cross the berlin wall
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at least 800 more people were killed outside berlin trying to cross from east germany to the west

lines.value: the east germans did not record all of the deaths so the real number of how many people died may never be known

lines.value: this led to a public outcry
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: american troops watched him but could not help him
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the east german border policemen who had wounded him did not help him either

lines.value: this is unusual because the east german border police had orders to not shoot on pregnant women children or mentally ill people

lines.value: his speech and its fallout probably led to the wall's demolition

lines.value: by late 1989 the gdr was suffering from many problems such as a struggling economy and large scale protests
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the hungarian regime had collapsed and was dismantling its border fences with austria by august 1989
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: since the warsaw pact allowed citizens to travel within the soviet bloc many east german tourists fled to the west via hungary
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when the hungarian government refused the gdr's demand to stop defectors east germany banned all travel to hungary prompting demonstrations and protest
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this began the gdr's isolation within the bloc
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: erich honecker leader of the gdr since 1971 was forced to resign on october 18 1989

lines.value: he was replaced by egon krenz after a unanimous vote by the politburo
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: under krenz's regime east germans could still escape to hungary via czechoslovakia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the number of defectors grew and caused tensions between east germany and czechoslovakia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the krenz regime decided to allow people to leave directly to the west through border checkpoints in east berlin
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this prompted many east germans who learned about it broadcast from west german media to go to the border crossings and demand to be let through immediately
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: border guards at each checkpoint told the people to go back home as they had no orders that the wall would open that night
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as time passed the number of people arriving at the checkpoint was increasing and the guards were becoming alarmed
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they began taking the more aggressive people aside and stamped their passports with a special stamp that allowed them access to west berlin however the people weren't aware that they were effectively revoking their east german citizenship and were shocked to be refused entry back into the gdr
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the chief guard of the checkpoint frantically telephoned his superiors hoping to get answers as to why so many people thought that the wall was to open
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: by 22:45 it was clear that the outnumbered and overwhelmed border guards would not use their weapons to suppress the crowds
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the chief guard surrendered and ordered the gates to west berlin to be opened
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the crowds of east berliners were met with crowds of west berliners in a happy scene as the berlin wall had just fallen
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many people even climbed up onto the wall by the brandenburg gate in protest and began to chisel away at the wall
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the gdr authorities responded to this initially by blasting the people with water cannons this proved to be ineffective
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the east german army later climbed up onto the wall to prevent others from standing on the wall
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the government began demolishing the wall the next day
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the fall of the wall destroyed the sed the ruling party of the gdr and caused many of its officials to resign
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the german democratic republic would cease to exist less than a year later reuniting with the federal republic of germany on october 3 1990
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the wall was changed and added to several times

lines.value: it was not really a wall but a collection of walls and fences and other devices

lines.value: this is what the border fence was made of starting from the east going west the border between east germany and west germany was also heavily defended with fences and mines
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: east germans needed a special permit to live close to the border

lines.value: after the reunification of germany in october 3 1990 the berlin wall was demolished and taken away

lines.value: a few sections of the wall remain some of the sections became a museum

lines.value: the east berlin special police who guarded the wall had the order to shoot if this was necessary to stop people fleeing

lines.value: east german leaders such as egon krenz were arrested after german reunification because guards were ordered to shoot to kill

lines.value: however after the wall was built many people were no longer able to leave east berlin using normal border posts

lines.value: the only way they could do so was to race through the wall or try to dig a tunnel underneath

lines.value: after the unification of germany border guards who had shot people were convicted by west german courts
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the judges said that some of the laws of the border police about shooting were against human rights

lines.value: they therefore should have refused to shoot

lines.value: the same was of course applied to those people who had shot border police on their flight

lines.value: border guards who did shoot and stop someone from fleeing could get a reward of up to 500 marks

lines.value: some of those guards were sentenced after the unification

lines.value: the other choice was to not shoot or to miss badly

lines.value: such guards risked losing their well paid jobs

lines.value: the lynx is a small cat

lines.value: lynx have short tails and usually some hair on the ears

lines.value: they have large paws feet padded for walking on snow and long whiskers on the face

lines.value: the colour of the body is from light brown to grey and is sometimes marked with dark brown spots especially on the legs
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they weigh about 5 kg or about 11 pounds approximately the size of a large domestic cat and can weigh up to about 30 kg 66 pounds
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: lynx are similar to a regular house cat but larger
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they have a powerful body on short furry legs attached to hefty feet and a bobbed black tipped tail
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the fur is spotted and yellowish brown to grey

lines.value: it has a collar of fur around the face giving a triangular shape
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they also have long black ear tufts

lines.value: lynx live in the high forests with many shrubs reeds and grass

lines.value: they hunt only on the ground but can climb trees and swim

lines.value: they can be found in the some places in northern scandinavia in north america and also in the himalayas

lines.value: since the 1990s people try to move part of the population of the eurasian lynx to germany

lines.value: they can also be found in bialowieza forest northeastern poland and southern spain
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the colorado division of wildlife tried to move other wild lynx populations from canada back to the united states
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: lynx are usually although a small group may travel and hunt together occasionally

lines.value: mating takes place in the late winter and once a year the female gives birth to between two and four kittens

lines.value: the young stay with the mother for one more winter a total of around nine months before moving out to live on their own as young adults

lines.value: lynx make their dens in crevices or under ledges
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they feed on a wide range of animals from white tailed deer reindeer roe deer small red deer and chamois to smaller more usual prey snowshoe hares fish foxes sheep squirrels mice turkeys and other birds and goats
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they also eat ptarmigans voles and grouse

lines.value: hunting lynxes is illegal in many countries

lines.value: a conservation law is a statement used in physics that says that the amount of something does not change in time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: that thing could be as simple as mass or charge or something that has to be calculated like energy or angular momentum
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for example the law of conservation of mass is the conservation law that says that the amount of mass is always conserved even if it is changed into another form
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this means that if the mass of the universe could be measured right now its mass would be known tomorrow because it will not change
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for a long time people thought that these laws were true for the amount of mass and energy in the universe
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: later on albert einstein said that they were not completely true
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he said that mass could change into energy or the other way around
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if this happened it would be against the conservation laws because if mass was changed into energy the total amount of mass goes down and the total amount of energy goes up
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: einstein said that conservation laws could still be used if all the mass and all the energy were combined
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he said that even though the mass changes or the energy changes the sum when they are added together does not change
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: so now there is just one conservation law for mass and energy together
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: of course mass is measured in kilograms and energy is measured in joules
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they cannot be added together directly but einstein found a way to add them together
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he created the equation
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this equation means is that before adding the amount of mass to the amount of energy the mass must be multiplied by the speed of light and then by the speed of light again
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some of the things that are thought to be conserved are emmy noether showed that conservation laws can be said to arise from symmetries in the laws of physics
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this theorem called noether's theorem gives physicists an extremely powerful tool to try and solve complicated problems
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for example
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: conservation laws can come in two types global or local
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a global conservation law just says that the total amount of something in the universe does not change in time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a local conservation law says a little bit more than that
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it says that if the amount of something changed in one place it's because it moved in to or out of that place and we can measure that movement
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the chromosomes of a cell are in the cell nucleus
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they carry the genetic information
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: chromosomes are made up of dna and protein combined as chromatin
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: each chromosome contains many genes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: chromosomes come in pairs one set from the mother the other set from the father
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: cytologists label chromosomes with numbers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: chromosomes are present in every cell nucleus with very few and special exceptions
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this means they are found in all eukaryotes since only eukaryotes have cell nuclei
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when eukaryote cells divide the chromosomes also divide
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when a somatic body cell such as a muscle cell divides the process is called mitosis
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: before mitosis the cell copies all the chromosomes and then it can divide
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when they duplicate chromosomes look like the letter x
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when they are doubled the two halves are called chromatids see diagram
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the chromatids are joined at the centromere
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are 46 chromosomes in a human 23 pairs
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: everyone has a set of chromosomes from their father and a matching set from their mother
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they include a pair of sex chromosomes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the mother's eggs always contain an x chromosome while the father's sperm contains either a y chromosome or an x chromosome
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: that determines the sex of the child
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: to produce sex cells gametes the stem cells go through a different division process called meiosis
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this reduces the 23 pairs diploid to 23 singles haploid
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these when combined by fertilisation produce the new set of 23 pairs
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: different animals have different numbers of chromosomes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if a person does not have the usual number of chromosomes they may die or have one or more peculiarities
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for example they might get a genetic disorder like down syndrome extra chromosome 21 and klinefelter syndrome a male with two x chromosomes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some genetic disorders are more common than others
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: polytene chromosomes are over sized chromosomes which have developed from standard chromosomes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: specialized cells undergo repeated rounds of dna replication without cell division endomitosis
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: polytene chromosomes form when multiple rounds of replication produce many sister chromatids that are stuck together in parallel
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: polytene chromosomes are found in drosophila species and in nonbiting midges of the chironomidae family
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they are also present in another group of arthropods of the class collembola a protozoan group ciliophora mammalian trophoblasts and antipodal and suspensor cells in plants
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: polytene cells have a metabolic function
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: multiple copies of genes allows a high level of gene expression
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in drosophila melanogaster for example the chromosomes of the larval salivary glands undergo many rounds of endoreduplication
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this produces large amounts of glue before pupation
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: chromosome puffs seen in diagram are diffused uncoiled regions of the polytene chromosome
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they are sites of active transcription
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: n factorial written n is the number we get when we multiply every number from 1 to n if n is 0 n factorial is 1
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is used to find out how many possible ways there are to arrange n objects
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for example if there are 3 letters a b and c they can be arranged as abc acb bac bca cab and cba
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: that's 6 choices because a can be put in 3 different places b has 2 choices left after a is placed and c has only one choice left after a and b have been placed
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: that is 3x2x1 = 6 choices
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: more generally if there are three objects and we want to find out how many different ways there are to arrange or select them for the first object there are 3 choices for the second object there are only two choices left as the first object has already been chosen and finally for the third object there is only one position left
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: therefore 3
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: is equivalent to 3x2x1 or 6
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this function is a good example of recursion doing things over and over as 3
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: can be written as 3x(2 which can be written as 3x2x(1 and finally 3x2x1x(0
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: n can therefore also be defined as nx(n-1
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: with 0
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: = 1.the factorial function grows very fast
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are 3628800 ways to arrange 10 items
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: n is not defined for negative numbers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however the related gamma function is defined over the real and complex numbers but the integers it is defined over are positive
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: centripetal force is an accelerating force that acts on any body that revolves around a centre

lines.value: this force contributes to keeping the body in circular motion
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this force is always directed towards the centre
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the opposite force by isaac newton's third law of motion is called centrifugal force

lines.value: this is the force that acts on the body in a direction away from the centre which contributes to making the body try to fly away
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when you hold a rope with a heavy object attached to it and rotate it around the rope becomes tight and keeps the body from flying away
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is caused by centripetal force
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: an example is a roller coaster which uses centripetal force to accelerate the carts so they will keep going in a circular motion
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: even if an object changes direction but maintains at a constant speed it still counts as acceleration

lines.value: aaron copland 1900-1990 was an american composer who wrote modern music
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: aaron copland wrote many kinds of music
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he wrote music for the orchestra piano and voice
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he wrote music for plays movies and dance
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: copland also was a conductor pianist speaker teacher and writer
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: music critics say copland taught americans about themselves through his music
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he used parts of many old american folksongs in his work
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he wanted to do this after studying music in france
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he said that composers there had a very french way of writing music
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he said americans had nothing like that in this country
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: so he decided to compose music that was truly american
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: aaron copland was born november 14 1900 in brooklyn new york
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he died at the age of 90 on december 2 1990
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was the youngest of five children
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his parents had come to the united states from eastern europe
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they owned a store in brooklyn
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: aaron began playing the piano when he was a young child
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he wrote his first song for his mother when he was eight years old
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his dreams of becoming a composer began when he was young
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when he was sixteen he asked his parents to let him study composing with rubin goldmark
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: goldmark had taught the composer george gershwin
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when he was in his early twenties copland went to paris france where he studied music with nadia boulanger
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she was one of the most important music teachers of the time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he returned to new york in 1924
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the famous conductor of the boston symphony orchestra serge koussevitzky learned about copland's music
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: koussevitzky led the orchestra for the first performance of copland's early work music for the theater in 1925
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: koussevitzky also conducted copland's concerto for piano and orchestra in 1927
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this work was unusual because copland used ideas from jazz music in his concerto
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: copland later wrote the music for two ballets about the american west
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: one was about the life of a famous gunfighter called billy the kid
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: copland used music from american cowboy songs in this work
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this piece from billy the kid ballet suite is called street in a frontier town
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1942 the conductor andre kostelanitz asked copland to write music about a great american abraham lincoln
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: copland wrote lincoln portrait to honor america's 16th president
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: copland's music included parts of american folk songs and songs popular during the american civil war
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he added words from president lincoln's speeches and letters
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: lincoln portrait has been performed many times in america
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many famous people have done the speaking part.eleanor roosevelt the wife of president franklin d roosevelt was one of them
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: here actor james earl jones performs in copland's lincoln portrait in 1942 the music director of the cincinnati symphony orchestra asked 18 composers to write music expressing love for america
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for the competition copland composed fanfare for the common man
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: " this music is played in america during many national events including some presidential inaugurations when they become presidents
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: experts say fanfare for the common man was an example of the way copland changed the kind of music he wrote during the 1940s
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he began writing music that was more easily understood and more popular
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: copland wrote about this in 1941 in his book our new music
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he wrote that the radio and record player was helping people who had never listened to music before to enjoy music
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he said that there was no reason to continue writing music as if these things had not been invented
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: so he decided to write music in a simpler way
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: copland spread his ideas about music in other ways
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he taught at the new school for social research in new york city and at harvard university in cambridge massachusetts
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: one of the many awards he received was the pulitzer prize
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he won it in 1945 for his famous music for a ballet called appalachian spring it is one of his most popular works
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the last part of the ballet is based on a traditional song a gift to be simple
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: copland also wrote music for several major movies
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he won an academy award in 1950 for composing the music for the movie the heiress
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: then he began experimenting with what is called the twelve tone system
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his music was no longer as easy to understand nor as popular
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: copland stopped composing at the end of the 1960s
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: yet he continued to be active as a conductor and speaker
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1982 queens college of the city university of new york established the aaron copland school of music
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: copland was a strong supporter of liberal ideas

lines.value: public opinion changed though
