lines.value: some work for other agencies such as ambulance companies or hospitals to ride on ambulances to transport sick and injured people
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: fire engines sometimes go to medical emergencies if they are closer and can give first aid before the ambulance gets there
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a fire truck usually carries the same equipment as an ambulance does
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: search and rescue is also done by many fire departments
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: firefighters have vehicles they drive to fires and rescue operations
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if the vehicle pumps water it is called an engine
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if it does not pump water it is called a truck
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a rescue truck's main job is to responds to car wrecks collapsed buildings search and rescue stuck elevators and other emergencies
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if it carries a fire chief to fires it is a fire chief car
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: fire engines pump water and foam which is used to put out the fire
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: fire trucks carry ladders and tools to help rescue people from burning buildings
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most carry first aid kit s to help people who are injured or hurt
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: firefighters must wear heavy clothing which protects them from the heat when they are fighting with a fire
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is called bunker gear or turnout gear
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: pyotr ilyich tchaikovsky (, petr il'ic cajkovskij ) born kamsko votkinsk 7 may 1840 died st petersburg 6 november 1893 was a russian composer who lived in the romantic period
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he is one of the most popular of all russian composers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he wrote melodies which were usually dramatic and emotional
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he learned a lot from studying the music of western europe but his music also sounds very russian
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his compositions include 11 operas 3 ballets orchestral music chamber music and over 100 songs
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his famous ballets swan lake the nutcracker and sleeping beauty have some of the best known tunes in all of romantic music
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: tchaikovsky's father was a ukrainian who worked as a mining engineer
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his mother's grandfather was a frenchman who had moved to russia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she was a nervous woman and tchaikovsky may have gotten his nervous character from her
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: tchaikovsky was only five when he started taking piano lessons
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was soon better than his teacher
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the family had an orchestrion a kind of musical box which played some tunes from classical music by mozart bellini donizetti and rossini
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1848 the family moved to st petersburg
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: tchaikovsky was unhappy and unsettled as he was often separated from his family who moved several times
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1854 his mother died
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he tried to comfort himself by playing music
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he spent nine years at the school of jurisprudence
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when he left school he had to get a job
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for four years he worked as a clerk in the ministry of justice
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: then the composer and pianist anton rubinstein helped him to become a music student at the newly opened conservatory in st petersburg
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he learned to play the flute and the organ as well as the piano and learning all about composition
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1866 he moved to moscow where nikolai rubinstein the brother of anton encouraged him to write music with a russian character
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he worked very hard and was often exhausted but he managed to finish his first symphony which was performed in 1868
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: tchaikovsky met some famous musicians including the french composer berlioz who was visiting moscow
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he also became friendly with the russian composer mily balakirev who was very helpful and persuaded him to rewrite one of his works several times until it was very good
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the result was a piece for orchestra called romeo and juliet which soon became internationally known
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: balakirev had four friends who were composers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this circle of friends is often called the five or the mighty handful
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they were interested in using russian folktunes in their music
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: tchaikovsky was never a member of the group although he liked their ideas
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: tchaikovsky was different to them he had learned music at the conservatoire where he had studied western music
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the harmonies that he used in his works were often not suitable for russian folktunes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he wrote many songs which are romantic in character
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: one of them none but the lonely heart is especially well known in english
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: by now tchaikovsky was writing works which were to make him very famous
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he wrote two more symphonies and his first piano concerto one of the most popular of all piano concertos was given its first performance in boston
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was also writing operas and chamber music
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1875 tchaikovsky began making a long tour of europe
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he liked bizet's opera carmen but wagner's operas from the ring cycle bored him
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1877 he finished swan lake the first of his three ballets
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the audience did not like it at first because the dancers were not very good
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: tchaikovsky was a closeted homosexual
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the summer of 1877 tchaikovsky decided to marry
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his wife was called antonina milyukova
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the marriage was a disaster
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a few weeks after the marriage he ran away and never lived with her again
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: another woman was to become important in his life but in a very different way
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was to be a very unusual relationship
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: her name was nadezhda von meck
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she was the wife of a rich man
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she loved tchaikovsky's music and promised him that she would pay him a lot of money every month so long as he promised her that he would never try to meet her
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: tchaikovsky no longer needed to work
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was able to give up his teaching job at the conservatory
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for several years he spent the winters in europe and the summers in russia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: nadezhda and tchaikovsky wrote long letters to one another often quite passionate and dreamy they talked about love life and how they wanted it to change but they never saw one another
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he had plenty of time to write music he wrote several operas including eugene onegin and his fourth and fifth symphonies the violin concerto the serenade for strings capriccio italienne and the 1812 overture
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: tchaikovsky loved nadezhda very much but never actually told her his true feelings
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: by 1885 tchaikovsky had tired of travelling around
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he rented a country house in klin just outside moscow
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he lived a regular life reading walking in the forest composing during the day and playing music with his friends in the evenings
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he started to have more confidence as a conductor and toured europe twice conducting in leipzig berlin prague hamburg paris and london
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1889 he finished his second ballet the sleeping beauty and the next year while staying in florence he wrote his famous opera the queen of spades based on a story by pushkin
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: later that year nadezhda von meck wrote to him that she had lost nearly all her money and could not continue to support him
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the spring of 1891 he was invited to conduct in new york where the carnegie hall was being opened
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he also conducted concerts in baltimore and philadelphia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when he returned to russia he wrote his last ballet the nutcracker and his known as the pathetique which was dedicated to his nephew with whom he was passionately in love
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this work is often considered his best
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was performed in st petersburg on 16 october 1893
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: five days later he suddenly became ill with cholera a disease many people were catching in the city
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: tchaikovsky died four days later
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many people think that he committed suicide by deliberately drinking contaminated water
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he may have wanted to or even been forced to commit suicide in order to avoid a scandal because he was having a relationship with a nephew of an important aristocratic man
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: exactly what happened is still a mystery
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: soil erosion is the washing or blowing away by water or wind of the top layer of soil dirt
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is a serious problem for farmers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if the soil has eroded the crops that make food will not grow very well
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: soil erosion was a big problem in the midwestern united states in the 1930s dust bowl
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: erosion also leaves large sinkholes in the ground which can weaken buildings and even cause them to collapse
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: urban areas are usually protected from soil erosion so not many buildings collapse from erosion
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: soil erosion can be conserved in several ways
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: dover is the capital city of the us state of delaware
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is the county seat of kent county which is in the middle of the state
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: dover had 36047 people in 2010
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: william penn founded dover as the court town for newly established kent county in 1683
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: penn was the proprietor of the territory generally known as the lower counties on the delaware in 1717 a special commission of the delaware general assembly laid out the city
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the capital of the state of delaware was moved here from newcastle in 1777 because of its central location and relative safety from british raiders on the delaware river
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: because of an act passed in october 1779 the assembly elected to meet at any place in the state they saw fit meeting successively in wilmington lewes dover newcastle and lewes again until the capital moved to dover permanently in october 1781
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the city's central square known as the green was the location of many rallies troop reviews and other patriotic events
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: today the green remains the heart of dover's historic district and is the location of the delaware supreme court and the kent county courthouse
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: dover was most famously the home of caesar rodney the popular wartime leader of delaware during the american revolution
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: dover and kent county were deeply divided over the issue of slavery and the city was a stop on the underground railroad
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was also home to a large quaker community that encouraged a sustained emancipation effort in the early nineteenth century
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there were very few slaves in the area but a majority of people wanted to keep slavery legal until the civil war
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the main north south highway through dover is us route 13 which runs through the main commercial strip of dover on the multi lane divided dupont highway
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: an alternate route of us route 13 us route 13 alternate passes through downtown dover on governors avenue
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the delaware route 1 turnpike which provides the main route to wilmington and the delaware beaches passes to the east of dover
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it ends near the dover air force base and de 1 continues south on bay road
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: us route 113 formerly ran along bay road from milford to us 13 near the state capitol complex however it was decommissioned in 2004 to avoid the concurrency with de 1 between the dover air force base and milford
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: delaware route 8 is the main east west route through dover passing through downtown on division street and west dover on forrest avenue
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it continues west toward maryland to provide access to the chesapeake bay bridge
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: dover is one of only four state capitals not served by an interstate highway
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: dover air force base is inside the southeast corporate limits of dover however the closest sizable civilian airport to dover is the new castle airport in new castle
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the closest airports with commercial air service to dover include the wicomico regional airport in salisbury maryland the baltimore washington international thurgood marshall airport in baltimore maryland and the philadelphia international airport in philadelphia pennsylvania
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: dover is on a former pennsylvania railroad line which is now served by norfolk southern
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at one time dover had a daily amtrak passenger service however the line now is just used for local freight
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the closest passenger rail station is the amtrak station in wilmington
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: dart first state provides weekday local bus service throughout dover speading from the water street transfer center in downtown
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they also provide inter county service to wilmington and georgetown and seasonal service to rehoboth beach
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: greyhound lines are provided as inter city bus transportation
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: dover has delaware state university a land grant university and delaware's only historically black university and wesley college
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is also home to the terry campus of the delaware technical & community college and that college's administrative offices
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: dover also has satellite locations of the university of delaware and wilmington university
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: three public high schools serve dover residents
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: caesar rodney high school in the caesar rodney school district just outside the city in camden dover high school in the capital school district and polytech high school in the polytech school district in woodside
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the dover air force base middle school is on the grounds of the dover air force base
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this school is unusual in that it is run by the caesar rodney school district and not the department of defense
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: autumn is the season after summer and before winter
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the united states this season is also called fall
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the northern hemisphere it is often said to begin with the autumnal equinox in september and end with the winter solstice in december
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the southern hemisphere it runs from the autumnal equinox in march to the winter solstice in june
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in many places in the temperate zone autumn is a time for harvesting most crops
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: deciduous trees trees that lose their leaves every year lose their leaves usually after turning yellow red or brown
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in many countries autumn is the time a new school year starts
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the uk the period of school between the start of september and the end of december is known as the autumn term
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when it is autumn in the northern hemisphere it is spring in the southern hemisphere
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when it is autumn in the southern hemisphere it is spring in the northern hemisphere
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on the equator autumn is very much like spring with little difference in temperature or in weather
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: autumn is a time when most animals are looking for food so they can store up for winter because they soon will be going into hibernation
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the weather gets colder and more windy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in autumn the hours of daylight and the hours of night are the same
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in autumn the weather changes all the time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the weather turns cooler and often windy and rainy

lines.value: iridium is the 77th element on the periodic table

lines.value: ir's atomic number(the amount of protons is 77.iridium is a metal
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: iridium is a rare metal and is therefore expensive
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is known as a noble metal
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: iridium belongs to a group of metals known as transition metals
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it looks like platinum and is found in asteroids and comets

lines.value: iridium deposits are used to identify relative dates of collisions of foreign bodies iridium is a very costly metal that can fold and bend just like aluminum and remains very shiny
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is relatively rare on the earth's crust
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most iridium is found in the americas though some is found in myanmar south africa and russia.iridium is the most corrosion resistant metal melts at 2410 °c and boils at 4130 °c.iridium is not needed in the body
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a man named smithson tennant first found it in the year 1803

lines.value: smithson tennant found it in the remains when he left crude platinum in a mixture of hydrochloric acid and nitric acid

lines.value: alacant or alicante (, valencian ) is a city in spain

lines.value: it is also a historic mediterranean port

lines.value: including nearby municipalities alicante was populated by 458843 residents

lines.value: population of the metropolitan area including elche and satellite towns was 795034 as of 2009

lines.value: the city is a sea port and a tourist centre

lines.value: it has a hot semi arid climate bsh in the koeppen climate classification

lines.value: the avenue maisonnave is the principal commercial street in the city of alicante

lines.value: in fact maisonnave is the sixth most expensive avenue in the whole of spain which gives an idea of the importance that this street has

lines.value: the corte ingles has in this central street both branches that it possesses in alicant one at each end of the avenue

lines.value: santa barbara's castle is 166 metres up the benacantil mountain
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it's very strong with great strategic value

lines.value: it's called santa barbara's castle because the 4th of december is santa barbara's day and the 4th of december in 1248 is when it was taken from the arabs by alfonso of castilla

lines.value: salman rushdie ( nastaliq ; born 19 june 1947 known as mallun rushdie in the islamic world is a novelist and essayist
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he is the author of midnight's children 1981 which won the booker prize
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it later won the booker of bookers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: rushdie was born in india but was sent to england to go to private school
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he has lived in the united states since 2000
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: salman rushdie is well known for writing stories which use magic realism which is similar to surrealism
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this means that things in his stories happen which may be magic or impossible such as falling from an aeroplane and floating down as gently as paper
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he often writes about india and his stories often are set in different parts of the world
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1988 rushdie wrote a book called the satanic verses
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the book included a fictional story about some characters with a made up religion
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some people have said that it insults muhammad but others disagree
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: rushdie said about the story his prophet was not called muhammad lived in a city not called mecca and created a religion not or not quite called islam
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: and he appeared only in the dream sequences of a man being driven insane by his loss of faith
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: because of this book a fatwa was issued by ayatollah ruhollah khomeini of iran
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it called for rushdie's execution
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the leader of the country of iran talked on the radio about rushdie
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he said that rushdie did not believe in islam and that rushdie should be executed because he thought the book was bad
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is called a fatwa
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the year 1989 the british government began protecting rushdie
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he says he has always been an atheist but is still interested in religion
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: rushdie was knighted for services to literature in the queen's birthday honours on 16 june 2007
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many nations with muslim majorities were not happy with this
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: pakistan's religious affairs minister muhammad ijaz ul haq said the knighthood was wrong
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: then the prime minister of pakistan benazir bhutto said this was not the way pakistan thought
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: their fathers zia ul haq and zulfikar ali bhutto were in rushdie's novel shame
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the bbc said that in 1998 the iranian government gave a public commitment it would not carry out the death sentence against mr rushdie but some people such as iranian hardliners don't agree
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he has been married four times
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his last marriage was to actress and model padma lakshmi they divorced in 2007
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: marathi () is the language spoken in maharashtra india

lines.value: it is at least one thousand years old and is based on sanskrit

lines.value: louis pasteur december 27 1822 - september 28 1895 was a french microbiologist and chemist
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he and his wife marie are best known for their experiments supporting the germ theory of disease and he is also known for his vaccinations most notably the first vaccine against rabies
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he made many discoveries in the field of chemistry including the asymmetry different shapes of crystals
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he is also well known for his way of keeping milk and wine from going sour for longer periods of time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: that process is called pasteurization
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: pasteur's later work on diseases included work on chicken cholera
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: during this work pasteur noticed how a culture of the responsible bacteria had spoiled and it failed to induce the disease in some chickens which he was infecting with the disease
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: louis pasteur was born on december 27 1822 in dole in the jura region of france into the family of a poor tanner
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: louis grew up in the town of arbois
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he gained degrees in letters and in mathematical sciences before entering the ecole normale superieure an elite college
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after serving briefly as professor of physics at dijon lycee in 1848 he became professor of chemistry at the university of strasbourg where he met and courted marie laurent daughter of the university's rector in 1849
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: louis pasteur and marie were married on may 29 1849 and together had five children
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: only two survived to adulthood his other three children had died of typhoid fever
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these personal tragedies inspired pasteur to try to find cures for diseases such as typhoid
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1895 at marnes la coquette a commune in paris pasteur died after several strokes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a switch is something that changes the flow of an electrical circuit

lines.value: the most common kind of switch is something for example a railroad switch which can be taken off of one course and put onto another
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the term switch usually means electrical power
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in applications where more than one switch is needed i.e a telephone service mechanical switches have been replaced by electronic switches which can be controlled automatically
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the switch is called a gate when used in a mathematical form
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in logic arguments are represented as logic gates
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the use of electronic gates to work as a system of logical gates is the basic idea behind the computer -i.e a computer is a lot of electronic switches that work as logic gates
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are many types of switches
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some of these are
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the word switch can also mean to change between two things
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for example on a railway line sometimes the track can split into two different tracks

lines.value: if the train is travelling on one line and changes over to the other it has just done a switch

lines.value: the summer olympic games or the games of the olympiad are an international sporting event which are held every four years by the international olympic committee
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the games as they are often called are held in a different city each time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is a great honour for a city to be awarded given the right to hold the olympic games
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: two years after the summer olympics the winter olympic games are held
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these are always in a cold mountainous place because the sports are all snow and ice sports such as skiing
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many more countries send athletes to the summer olympics than to the winter olympics
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the olympic games were first held in ancient greece more than two thousand years ago
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the first modern summer olympic games were held in athens in 1896
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there were 200 athletes from greece and 45 athletes from 13 other countries
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: since 1904 medals have been given to the three best athletes or teams in each sport
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the earliest games consisted of 42 events only but it was expected that 10500 athletes would in the 302 events on the program for the 2008 summer olympics in beijing
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: games in italics were cancelled or have not yet been held
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: *athletics at the summer olympics
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: differentials are the main focus of differential calculus
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: see differential equation
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: differentials can also be used in automobiles where they are used for turning for example while turning right the right wheel travels a shorter distance than the left the differential slows down the wheel so it will not slip
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is because the inside right wheel is closer to the center of the turn meaning that it travels on an arc with a shorter radius thus resulting in less distance traveled
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: toes are the digits of the foot of an animal
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many animal species walk on their toes and are called digitigrade
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: humans and other animals that walk on the soles of their feet are plantigrade hoofed animals are unguligrade
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in humans the bones of each toe continue all the way to the heel although in from the base of the toes they come together in the body of the foot
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the inside toe is by far the thickest and is called the big toe great toe or hallux
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the one on the other end is short and thin
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the toes especially the big toe play an essential role in walking although a loss of the smallest toe will not affect the way people move
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: baroque music is a big era and a set of styles of european classical music which were in use between about 1600 and 1750
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the word baroque is used in other art forms besides music we talk about baroque architecture painting sculpture dance and literature
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the baroque period comes between the renaissance and the period of classicism
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: musicians think of the baroque period as starting around 1600
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the famous renaissance composers palestrina and lassus had died a few years earlier
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: claudio monteverdi wrote some music in renaissance style and other music in baroque style
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: opera was being invented
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was a time of musical change
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the change from writing music in the baroque style to the classical style was much more gradual
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: 1750 is the year that bach died so it is an easy date to choose for the end of the baroque period
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the baroque was a time when people liked large spaces and a lot of ornamentation
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this can be seen in the architecture of famous buildings such as st peter's basilica rome or st paul's cathedral london
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they were built at this time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in venice there were churches with galleries on either side of the church
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: composers liked to write music for two groups of musicians placed in opposite galleries
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: giovanni gabrieli wrote a lot of music like this
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the idea of two contrasting groups was used a lot in baroque music
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: composers wrote concertos
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these were pieces for orchestra and a solo instrument
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sometimes a concerto contrasted a group of soloists with the rest of the orchestra
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these are called by the italian name concerti grossi
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: bach's brandenburg concertos are good examples.organs and some harpsichords had at least two manuals keyboards
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the player could change from one manual to the other contrasting two different sounds.baroque music was often a melody with a bass line at the bottom
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this could be for example a singer and a cello
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there was also a harpsichord or organ that played the bass line as well and made up chords in between
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: often the composer did not bother to write out all the chords harmonies but just showed some of the chords by figures leaving it to the performer to decide exactly which notes to play
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is called figured bass or basso continuo
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the soloist who played or sang the melody on top often put in lots of ornamental notes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: again the composer did not write this all down but left it to the performer to improvise something nice around the notes he had written
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: because composers were now writing opera it was important for the audience to hear the words clearly
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the renaissance the groups of a choir were often singing several different words using different melodies all at once
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this was called polyphony
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: polyphony was widely used in instrumental music but was not used in opera which needed to tell a story without being confusing
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when a soloist in an opera sings a song an aria the aria is in a particular mood
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they called this affection
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there were several affections or moods there were arias about revenge jealousy anger love despair peaceful happiness etc each movement in a concerto also had one particular mood
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: music from later periods is different
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for example haydn in the classical period would often change its mood during a piece
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the baroque suite is a collection of dance movements written in the style of baroque music
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there is an accepted standard order in which the dances are performed
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the five primary dances are the overture allemande courante sarabande and gigue
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many times a composer would add a prelude before all the dances
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sometimes a composer would add another piece in between the sarabande and the gigue
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are many exceptions to the standard order but the order of prelude allemande courante sarabande other and gigue is most common
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this can be easily remembered by the acronym pacsog
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: here are a few of the most important composers of the baroque period
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: * music in the baroque era manfred bukofzer j.m.dent 1948
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: edward benjamin britten baron britten of aldeburgh om ch born lowestoft 22 november 1913 died aldeburgh 4 december 1976 was probably the greatest english composer of his time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he came from east anglia a region in the east of england and he often thought about the east anglian landscape and the sea when writing his music
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he wrote a lot of music for his long term partner the tenor peter pears
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his operas include peter grimes billy budd a midsummer night's dream and death in venice
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his war requiem was performed in coventry cathedral in 1962 after it had been rebuilt because the old cathedral had been destroyed in the war
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he wrote music for children which sounds like proper adult music
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: britten started the aldeburgh festival
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was an excellent pianist and conductor
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: benjamin britten started composing music at the age of five although he had no one to help him
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when he was ten years old he took part in an amateur music festival in norwich
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a composer called frank bridge heard him and was so impressed that he offered to teach him composition
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he helped britten to compose using proper musical techniques
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: britten started to get to know music by a lot of important modern composers including schoenberg and bartok
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1930 he went to the royal college of music
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he had excellent piano teachers but he did not learn much from his composition teacher john ireland and most of the music he wrote was never performed
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: britten was more interested in music from abroad than in english music
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1934 he heard the opera wozzeck by alban berg
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he wanted to go to austria to study with berg but he was not allowed to
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: meanwhile some of his first proper compositions started to be performed
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he wrote some music for movies that were being made by the general post office including one about a train delivering mail
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the music describes the rhythm of the train rushing along
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: while working on the movie music he met the writer w h auden
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he started to be interested in political ideas
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these can be heard in some works he wrote at this time such as our hunting fathers 1936 and ballad of heroes 1939
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when auden emigrated to the united states britten followed him
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: with him was the tenor peter pears who was to become a lifelong friend and partner and who was to be the inspiration for many songs and operas
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: britten wrote several compositions in the usa including sinfonia da requiem 1940 and his first string quartet 1941
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the following year he was reading about the poet george crabbe who came from suffolk the same part of england where britten had grown up
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: britten suddenly became homesick
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he realized that he could not work and be himself in a foreign country
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: so he returned with pears to england
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as soon as he was on the boat sailing back to england he started work on ceremony of carols
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: back in england britten and pears gave concerts to audiences of all kinds and took part in opera productions of sadler's wells opera company which was having a new theatre built
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on the 7 june 1945 the new theatre was opened with a performance of britten's opera peter grimes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this opera was to make britten into the most famous english composer of his time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was soon being performed abroad as well as in england
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: britten was now composing lots of music songs chamber music and a very popular piece called young person's guide to the orchestra also known as variations and fugue on a theme of purcell
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this piece shows off each instrument of the orchestra in turn so that young people can get to know the sound of the musical instruments
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is based on a tune written by henry purcell 300 years ago
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there were more popular works st nicolas and the spring symphony
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there were not many opportunities for big operas to be performed so he wrote some chamber operas which only needed small orchestras and a small number of singers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these were performed in places such as local churches by a group which called themselves english opera group
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he wrote the rape of lucretia 1946 and albert herring 1947
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1948 the group helped to start a music festival in aldeburgh
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: benjamin britten spent the rest of his life mainly working on music which was to be performed at the aldeburgh festival
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he composed some of his greatest works for the festival and he took part in the performances as conductor and pianist
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: one of britten's most popular pieces of music for amateurs including children was noye's fludde 1957
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he wrote three church parables
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his large operas include billy budd 1951 which was soon produced in covent garden
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in june 1953 he wrote gloriana an opera about queen elizabeth i written for the coronation celebrations of elizabeth ii
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when he travelled with peter pears to the far east he was influenced by the music of bali and he composed a ballet called the prince of the pagodas performed in covent garden in 1957
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: another great work inspired by the east was the parable curlew river 1964
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the opera a midsummer night's dream was written for the aldeburgh festival in 1960
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1962 he wrote the war requiem to celebrate the new coventry cathedral
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is one of the greatest musical works of the 20th century
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1961 he became friends with the great russian cellist mstislav rostropovich
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he composed a cello sonata and a cello symphony 1963 a kind of cello concerto as well as three suites for solo cello
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he travelled with pears to the soviet union
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1967 the aldeburgh festival had a new concert hall the maltings at snape
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his next opera was owen wingrave 1970 written for television but soon produced in covent garden
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in june 1973 britten produced another great opera death in venice
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the main character called aschenbach was perhaps the best music he ever wrote for peter pears
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was performed at the aldeburgh festival but britten was ill by this time and unable to be at the performance
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his heart condition made it impossible to work on any more large works but he still wrote some harp music for the harpist ossian ellis a song called phaedra for janet baker and a third string quartet
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he died in aldeburgh on 4 december 1976
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: britten received many honours both in britain and in other countries
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he became a companion of honour in 1952 a member of the order of merit in 1965 and in the year he died he was the first musician ever to receive a life peer the title lord britten
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: britten's early works were often written for instruments
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his variations on a theme of frank bridge 1937 for string orchestra is a very popular work today
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he often borrowed and reinvented themes by other composers this is called parody technique
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: during his last years he again gave much attention to instrumental music mainly chamber music
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after he met peter pears much of his music was vocal
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this includes more than 100 songs a number of operas chamber operas as well as three works for tenor solo and orchestra les illuminations the serenade for tenor horn and strings and the nocturne
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his songs are often grouped in cycles
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he also wrote many folksong settings
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these were very popular as encore pieces when he accompanied peter pears in song recitals
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: britten wrote music for choirs including hymn to st cecilia britten was proud of having been born on st cecilia's day 22 november
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the war requiem is his greatest work which combines writing for choir and orchestra
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it describes the horrors of war britten had refused to fight in world war ii
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he wrote a lot of work for children
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are even parts for children in some of his operas e.g peter grimes the turn of the screw and owen wingrave
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he even wrote an opera in which all the main parts are sung by children the little sweep 1949
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many of his great operatic roles from peter grimes to aschenbach in death in venice deal with the theme of the outsider the person who does not quite fit into society or who is misunderstood
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: britten's homosexuality which was something that was never discussed in his lifetime may have something to do with this
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he also knew what it was like to be an outsider when he tried to live in the united states and his refusal to fight in the war may have distanced him from some people
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the aldeburgh festival at the maltings in snape a village near aldeburgh continue to be a focus for britten's music
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: every year the brittens pears school of music organizes lessons and performance opportunities for young musicians
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a series of prom concerts is held there every year in august
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: fantasy is a genre of fiction make believe that shows some form of magic or supernatural force
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: often fantasy also means that the story takes place in another world different from our own e.g middle earth or narnia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: although the word fantasy is most often applied to low tech worlds it also can depict high tech worlds overlapping with science fiction e.g star wars
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: or it is used for historical fiction if it is magical in some way
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the ming dynasty was the family of emperors who led china from [[a.d.|]]1368 to 1644
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the name is also used to talk about the ming empire that they led and the 276 years in chinese history that it lasted
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is also famous for its pottery from jingdezhen in jiangxi and dehua in fujian
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the ming dynasty is known in chinese as the ming
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is written as in chinese characters
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the character is a sun () and a moon () together and means bright
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: chinese uses different words to talk about the different meanings of a chinese dynasty in english their government is called the ming chao (), their country is called the da ming diguo ( or ), and their time in chinese history is called the ming dai ().
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: unlike in english the name of the dynasty is not the same as the family name of the leaders
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the family that led china during the ming were the zhus
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is written as in chinese characters
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: today it's just a common chinese family name but it used to mean the kind of red coloring that you could make from cinnabar hgs
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the yuan dynasty before them had been part of the mongol empire started by genghis khan
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: its emperors had been mongolian people but most of china was han chinese
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: to keep their power the yuan used a chinese kind of government of three departments and six ministries with imperial examinations
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: their laws gave special powers to mongolian people though with other people from other countries semu placed second northern chinese third and southern chinese last
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they were especially nice to tibetan buddhists and gave many important jobs to muslims although they also made muslims break some rules and eat like mongolians
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some muslims were angry and started to fight the yuan
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many people began to fight after the 1340s
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the black death killed many people and the government did not keep up the work needed to stop the yellow river from killing people when it flooded
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the red turbans began fighting in 1351 and its best leader zhu yuanzhang made the yuan emperor toghun temur run away from the capital city khanbaliq now inside beijing in 1368
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when zhu yuanzhang took khanbaliq he said that the yuan was over and that his family would be a new dynasty called the ming
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he said that 1368 was the 1st year of the hongwu era and became known as the hongwu emperor
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: toghun temur and other mongolians still fought him but now they were known as the northern yuan and the ming became the real government of most of china
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the hongwu emperor had many sons and made them the leaders of the 13 different parts of china
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he did not stay in khanbaliq
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he made his old base yingtian today's nanjing into the new capital city
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he wanted china to be more traditional and more chinese so he ended most government support for other religions and made christianity against the law
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he wanted china to take care of itself so he ended most buying and selling of things from other countries
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he made a list of rules for his family and they mostly followed them during the rest of the ming
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the oldest son of the hongwu emperor died before him so the next emperor was his grandson the jianwen emperor
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the jianwen emperor was about 20 years old and didn't like the power of his many uncles
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he started taking away their power sending them away or even making them kill themselves
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the uncle leading beiping old khanbaliq and now beijing was named zhu di
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he pretended to be crazy so that the jianwen emperor would be less afraid
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the emperor even let his three sons kept in the capital city to be sure of their father's good behavior go north see him
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: zhu di then began a war against his nephew
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at first zhu di said his war was only against the bad helpers who told his nephew to hurt their family
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when his war was successful and he took yingtian now nanjing he made himself the yongle emperor
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he said that his nephew had never been the real emperor and killed many people in the old government
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he did not trust the people in yingtian so he made beiping the main capital city
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the southern capital then became known as nanjing and the northern capital beijing the names they continue to use today
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in beijing he built a new home which became the forbidden city
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the yongle emperor did not like many of the people in government who got there by doing well on their tests
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he gave more power to eunuchs men who were hurt as children to stop them from being able to have children of their own
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: one of these was zheng he a muslim who led great treasure ships south from suzhou and nanjing in 7 big trips between 1405 and 1433
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the first trips may have been looking for the jianwen emperor but they also became trips that taught china about the south china sea and indian ocean and opened up more buying and selling between their countries and china
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the mings main capital of beijing fell in 1644 to a rebellion led by li zicheng who established the shun dynasty
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this was soon replaced by the manchu led qing dynasty
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the people who still liked the ming continued to fight as the southern ming up to 1683
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the ming empire has been described as one of the greatest eras of orderly government and social stability in human history
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was the last chinese dynasty led by the han chinese not counting the short lived governments of li zicheng and yuan shikai
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is also famous for its pottery from jingdezhen in jiangxi and dehua in fujian
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in genealogy a cousin is a relative other than an ancestor or descendant who shares a common ancestor
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the word cousin is often used to refer to a person's first cousin the child of someone's aunt or uncle
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a first cousin once removed can be either if you have a second cousin once removed then you are also the second cousin once removed of that person
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: your second cousin's children are the third cousins of your children
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: each time it is removed once that person will go one generation down or up.each time it is removed twice that person will go two generations down or up
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: ida saxton mckinley june 8 1847 - may 26 1907 wife of william mckinley was first lady of the united states from 1897 to 1901
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she was born in canton ohio
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: her father was james a saxton who was a famous banker
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he educated ida and their sister well
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after their schooling they went to europe on a tour
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she started to work as a cashier in a bank
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1867 major william mckinley came to canton to start his work as a lawyer
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: ida and william mckinley came to know each other and they fell in love
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they married each other
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: while her husband devoted time to his work and career ida devoted time to her home and husband
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she had a daughter on the christmas day of 1871
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they named their daughter katherine
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she bore a second daughter in april 1873
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at that time ida was very weak and ill
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the second daughter dies in august
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: their first daughter also died in 1876
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: by this time ida had become very weak and an invalid
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the meanwhile her husband has become a congressman
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he them became a governor of ohio
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he always paid his attention to his wife and cared for her
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she spent most of her time in a small victorian rocking chair
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this chair was with her since her childhood
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when they entered the white house ida's health was very weak
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she took the role of the first lady but while seated in a blue velvet chair
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she sat by the side of her husband during official dinners
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the president kept a careful watch on her condition
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at that time very few people know of her bad physical condition
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: only in recent years people came to know of her bad physical condition
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: cruz manila
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she read a lot and knew about art and many other things
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: rizal said she was loving and very smart

lines.value: he learned the alphabet from his mother when he was three years old

lines.value: in 1877 at the age of 16 he finished school bachelor of arts from the ateneo municipal de manila

lines.value: he stopped in his studies when he felt that the filipino students were not being treated right by the priests who were also their teachers

lines.value: on may 3 1882 he went by boat to spain

lines.value: on june 21 1884 at the age of 23 he got his degree and became a doctor

lines.value: on june 191885 at the age of 24 he got another degree in philosophy and letters
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: having traveled throughout europe america and asia he spoke 22 languages

lines.value: these include a very smart man he was good at many other jobs besides being a doctor
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he hoped to make political changes in his country and to make the filipinos go to school
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: rizal wrote many poems and books that show his love for his country
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in march 1887 his book noli me tangere was published
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it shows the bad habits of the spanish priests
lines.name: Simple English

lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is sadder than his first book
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: rizal was not liked by those in power
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he told people about the bad things that were done by the priests and the people working for the government and this caused trouble for him and his relatives
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: because of this he and those who he knew were watched by the government
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they made up bad things about him
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when he arrived from hong kong with his sister lucia they said that in lucia's luggage they found letters rizal wrote that spoke about the priests in a bad way
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a league is an old unit of length
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was first an ancient celtic unit
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was the distance a person could walk in about one hour
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the romans adopted the league and it became a common unit of measurement throughout western europe and latin america
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in english speaking countries the league was usually three statute miles 4.828032 kilometres on land or three nautical miles at 5.556 km sea
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however in writing the word league often means the spanish portuguese or french league
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: an example is used in the book island of the blue dolphins
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the league was used by ancient rome which defined it as being roman miles 7500 roman feet or 2.22 km
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the origin is the leuga gallica also leuca gallica the league of gaul
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the ancient league was short but the unit grew longer over time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in argentina a league is a distance of 5 km
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in brazil the league was 6 km but it is not used anymore
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the french league had different values at different times 10 000 12 000 13 200 and 14 400 french feet about 3.25 km to about 4.68 km
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was used for a while together with the metric system but it is not used now
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the nautical league was three nautical miles
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the mexican countryside the league is still commonly used in the original sense of the distance a person can walk in an hour
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: so a league along a good road on level ground is longer than a league on a difficult path over rough ground
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the spanish league was originally set as a fixed unit of distance of 5000 varas a spanish yard about 2.6 miles or 4.2 km
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1568 philip ii of spain officially abolished the league

lines.value: however in parts of latin america people still use it with different meanings in different countries
