lines.value: yellowstone national park is a national park in the united states
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was the world's first national park
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: united states president ulysses s grant signed a law to create it
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the name was taken from the yellowstone river which flows through the park
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: yellowstone was made a unesco world heritage site in 1978
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: yellowstone national park is famous for its geysers and hot springs
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the park contains about half the world's geysers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the world's most famous geyser the old faithful geyser is in yellowstone national park
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it also is a home to grizzly bears wolves bison and elk
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many tourists visit the park each year to see the geysers and animals there
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the park is the center of the greater yellowstone ecosystem
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is the largest remaining nearly intact ecosystem in the earth's northern temperate zone
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it includes many types of ecosystems but the biggest is the subalpine forest
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: people have lived in the yellowstone area for about 11000 years
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some native americans still lived there when the first people came from europe came through in 1807/1808
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: john colter a trapper came within the lewis and clark expedition and visited a large area which was unknown to the western world at that time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: three years later he returned to st louis and told the people there that he had discovered a wonderland of hot springs and geysers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this area was yellowstone but nobody believed him so yellowstone still was not a famous place
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for the next sixty years only a few other trappers traveled through the area and the same thing happened to them
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when they reported that colter had been right nobody listened to their stories
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: then three expeditions between 1868 and 1871 visited yellowstone and took the news of its wonders back to the east
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: one year later on march 1 1872 united states president ulysses s grant signed a law to create the first national park in the world
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for the first sixteen years there was no money for the park
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: so from 1886 to 1917 the us army ran it
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: then the new national park service took over which has run yellowstone ever since then
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: yellowstone was proposed to be a unesco world heritage site in 1978
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the unesco committee elected yellowstone because it has significant geological and processes unique geothermal forces natural beauty and wild ecosystems where rare and endangered species thrive
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: [it is] one of the few remaining intact large ecosystems in the northern temperate zone of earth
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: about 96 percent of the park is in wyoming
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: three percent is in montana and only one percent in idaho
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is about 3500 sqmi large bigger than rhode island or delaware
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the park is on the yellowstone plateau at an average elevation of 8000 ft above sea level
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are mountain ranges on most sides of the plateau
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these are mountain ranges of the middle rocky mountains which range from 9000 ft to 11000 ft in elevation
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: three deep canyons are in the park
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they were cut through the volcanic tuff of the yellowstone plateau by rivers over the last 640000 years since the last huge explosion
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the most famous is called the grand canyon of the yellowstone
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the continental divide of north america runs diagonally through the southwestern part of the park
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this separates the pacific from atlantic water drainage areas
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the origins of the yellowstone and snake rivers are near each other but on opposite sides of the divide
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as a result the waters of the snake river flow to the pacific ocean while those of the yellowstone find their way to the atlantic ocean via the gulf of mexico
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: yellowstone is the site of a huge ancient volcano whose remains are called the yellowstone caldera
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the caldera is the largest volcanic system in north america
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the cause of the volcano was a hotspot in the earth's mantle over which the american continental plate moved
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: 640000 years ago a huge volcanic explosion blew 240 cumi of rock and lava into the air
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was 1000 times larger than the mount st helens eruption
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: yellowstone is still a geologically active volcano what means that a eruption is expected in future
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is monitored by the us geological survey
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there is ground movement geysers and small earthquakes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the floor of the caldera has been rising but experts say there is no immediate danger of eruption
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for three months in 1985 3000 minor earthquakes occurred in the northwestern section of the park
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: beginning on april 30 2007 sixteen small earthquakes with magnitudes up to 2.7 occurred in the yellowstone caldera for several days
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these swarms of earthquakes are common and there have been 70 such swarms between 1983 and 2008
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in january 2010 more than 250 earthquakes were detected over a two day period
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: seismic activity in yellowstone national park continues and is reported hourly by the earthquake hazards program of the us geological survey
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: yellowstone is widely seen to have the finest megafauna very big animals wildlife in all over the united states
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are almost 60 species of mammals in the park including the gray wolf the threatened lynx and grizzly bears
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: other large mammals are the bison buffalo black bear elk moose mule deer white tailed deer mountain goat pronghorn bighorn sheep and mountain lion
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: bison once numbered between 30 and 60 million throughout north america
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: yellowstone is one of their last strongholds
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: their number had increased from less than 50 in the park in 1902 to 4000 by 2003
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the highest number of bison in the park was 4900 in 2005
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: despite a summer estimated number of 4700 in 2007 the number dropped to 3000 in 2008
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: that was after a harsh winter and a controversial brucellosis management when hundreds were sent to slaughter
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the animal and plant health inspection service aphis has stated that with vaccinations and other means brucellosis can be eliminated from the bison and elk herds throughout yellowstone
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: starting in 1914 the us congress gave funds for the purposes of destroying wolves prairie dogs and other animals injurious to agriculture and animal husbandry on public lands
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after the wolves were gone from yellowstone the coyote became the park's top canine predator
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however the coyote cannot bring down large animals
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the result was a great increase in lame and sick megafauna
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: by the 1990s the federal government had changed its mind on wolves
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in a controversial decision by the us fish and wildlife service wolves imported from canada were brought into the park
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a survey conducted in 2005 showed there were 13 wolf packs totaling 118 wolves in yellowstone and 326 in the whole ecosystem
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the increase in the number of wolves in the states of wyoming montana and idaho has been so successful that they are no longer on the endangered species list
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: about 600 grizzly bears live in the greater yellowstone ecosystem with more than half living within yellowstone
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are over 30000 elk the largest number of any large mammal species in yellowstone
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the northern herd has become much smaller since the mid 1990s
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this may be caused by wolves
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: also elk use more forested regions to evade the wolves and make it harder for researchers to count them
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the northern herd migrates west into southwestern montana in the winter
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the southern herd migrates southward and the majority of these elk spend the winter on the national elk refuge southeast of grand teton national park
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the southern herd migration is the largest migration of mammals in the us outside of alaska
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 2003 the tracks of one female lynx and her cub were spotted and followed for over
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: fecal material and other evidence obtained were tested and confirmed to be those of a lynx
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: no one actually saw a lynx however
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: lynx have not been seen in yellowstone since 1998 though dna taken from hair samples showed that lynx were at least passing through the park
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: other mammals that are seen less often are the mountain lion and wolverine
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are about 25 mountain lions in the park
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: people do not know how many wolverines there are
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: yellowstone is also home to six species of reptiles such as the painted turtle and prairie rattlesnake and four species of amphibians including the boreal chorus frog
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: eighteen species of fish live in yellowstone including the yellowstone cutthroat trout
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this fish is highly sought by anglers and most of them live in yellowstone
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the yellowstone cutthroat trout has faced several threats since the 1980s including the suspected illegal introduction into yellowstone lake of lake trout an invasive species which eat the smaller cutthroat trout
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the cutthroat trout has also faced an ongoing drought as well as the accidental introduction of a parasite whirling disease which kills younger fish
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: since 2001 all native sport fish species caught in yellowstone waterways are subject to a catch and release law
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: 311 species of birds have been reported
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: almost half of them nest in yellowstone
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as of 1999 twenty six pairs of nesting bald eagles have been documented
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: extremely rare sightings of whooping cranes have been recorded only three are known to live in the rocky mountains out of 385 known worldwide
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: other birds considered to be species of special concern because of their rarity in yellowstone include the common loon harlequin duck osprey peregrine falcon and the trumpeter swan
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the reason for the extraordinary climate in yellowstone is the location of the rocky mountains
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the temperature at the mammoth hot springs is between in january and 81 f in july
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sudden temperature increase or decrease in the middle of a year are not a rare thing
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in summer there are temperatures of about 77 f in the lower areas but they can go up to 86 f sometimes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are many thunderstorms during the afternoons
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are relatively low temperatures during the night they can get down to lower null in the mountains
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: typical temperatures in winter are between
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the highest temperature was metered with 99 f in year 1936 while the lowest metered temperature is in year 1933 in mason
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: yellowstone has had many tourists
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is mostly because of the natural beauty of the yellowstone park
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: millions of people come to see it each and every year
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the park can be reached by five entrances from the north through livingston and gardiner montana by northeast through the beartooth pass wyoming by east through cody by south from jackson by bypassing the grand teton national park and by west through the idaho falls idaho
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: yellowstone offers many beautiful attractions for example geysers hot springs a deep canyon a river with many falls forests seas mountains wilderness and wildlife
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: more than 2.8 million tourists have visited yellowstone since 1990
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 2010 3.64 million people visited it
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: about 140000 people come in the winter to see snow attractions for example driving snowmobiles
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: more than 4500 people work in the various hotels parks and shops
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: conservation of the environment and life was a main reason for creating the national parks
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: even before the creation of yellowstone the naturalist henry david thoreau and other supporters asked the government to protect nature and animals in that area
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however when the park was finally created there was no such law
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a law to protect most of the animals from being shot was not adopted until 1883 nearly 10 years after the creation of the park
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: hunting protected animals was forbidden under that law
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: nevertheless poachers could still operate
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: so in 1894 a new law called national park protection act was adopted
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the us congress protected nature wildlife and other natural resources
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the new law forbade the killing or destroying of them and only fishing was allowed
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: nature for example trees mineral resources and other things was not allowed to be harmed
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: because yellowstone has many forests some fires could occur
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the last big fires were the yellowstone fires of 1988
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they damaged more than 560 sqmi of forest area and burned out more than 890 sqmi of trees and forest
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: also 97 sqmi of bush and grass were damaged
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the effect of the fire can still be seen in some places even after more than 20 years
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after 1988 new fire management plans were introduced people are now not to fight the fire but let them burn and watch them carefully
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is to keep the fire controlled
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: according to the 2004 plan natural wildfires are allowed to burn so long as fire size weather and potential danger are within limits

lines.value: ecosystem valuation is a widely used tool to find out the impact of human activities on an environmental system
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is done by giving an economic value to an ecosystem or its ecosystem services
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the simplest form of ecosystem valuation is that one looks at an ecosystem as if its ecological yield had the same value as it would be on commodity markets
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: that means one looks at the value of water wood fish or game that is produced in that ecosystem
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: thus a price can be put on the natural capital of an ecosystem based on the price of natural resources it yields each year
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: more complex arguments in ecosystem valuation regard nature's services and the assignment of values in a service economy to all that nature does for humans
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: studies compiled by robert costanza in the 1990s argued strongly that even just considering the most basic seventeen of these services the combined value of the ecosystems of the earth was worth more us$33t each year than the whole human exchange economy us$25t at that time 1995
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: other studies have focused on the marginal value of ecosystem changes which can be used in cost benefit analysis of environmental policies
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in natural capitalism 1999 paul hawken amory lovins and hunter lovins advanced an argument to assign the value of earth in current currency
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: see value of earth article for that and other examples of this extreme case of ecosystem valuation biosphere valuation
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: four types of values can be assigned to ecosystems pearce and turner 1990
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: such valuation and that of the effectiveness of various environmental health measures that affect the value of life and quality of life are usually thought to be part of economics
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: natural capital and individual capital are studied ecology as living systems however this does not extend to the economics of valuation by which they are related considering valuation as an economic not ecological issue reflects the way these fields divide of the activities of humans versus non humans in making a living
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when humans go out to get food or homes that is studied in economics but when non humans do it that is ecology though it is clear that there are motivations methods and certainly bodily needs in common
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: since animals do not put explicit prices on ecosystems they use but do behave as if they are valuable e.g by defending turf or access to water it is mostly a matter of definition whether ecology should include valuation as an issue
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it may be anthropocentric to do so since valuation more clearly refers to a human perception rather than being an objective attribute of the system perceived
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: ecology itself is also human perception and such related concepts as a food chain are constructed by humans to help them understand ecosystems
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in many cases by those who hold that markets and pricing exist independently of any individual human observers and users and especially those who deem markets to be out of control ecosystem valuation is considered a marginal ignored part of economics
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some versions of conflict theory focus on the role of resource scarcity in sparking or propagating human conflicts in effect holding that the resources or ecosystems they fight over are being held so valuable that they are worth considerable risk of harm to control
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is at least a relative notion of value and value at risk applied to ecosystem
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: arithmetic is a name for working with numbers

lines.value: the first people who lived on iceland are thought to have been irish monks
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they came to iceland around the year 800
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the 9th century norsemen went to live in iceland
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the first norseman who lived in iceland was floki vilgeroarson
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was also the one who gave iceland its name
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: ingolfur arnarsons was the first permanent settler on the island
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this chieftain from norway went to live in south west iceland and founded the city of reykjavik
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 930 the icelandic rulers wrote a constitution
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they created the althing a kind of parliament in a place called bingvellir
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: therefore iceland is the oldest existing republic
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 985 erik the red was sent away from the island because he had killed someone
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he sailed to the west and discovered greenland
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: eric's son leif ericson discovered america in the year 1000
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he called it vinland
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the voyages of eric leif and others were written down in the sagas long stories
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1262 iceland became part of norway
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this lasted for 400 years
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1662 it became part of denmark
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the 19th century many icelanders wanted to be independent from denmark
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1918 iceland got many powers of its own but the king of denmark was still king of iceland
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when germany took over denmark on april 9 1940 the althing decided that icelanders should rule the country themselves but they did not declare independence yet
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: british and later american soldiers occupied iceland to prevent it from being attacked by the germans
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1944 iceland finally became fully independent
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after world war ii iceland became a member of the north atlantic treaty organisation nato but not of the european union

lines.value: between 1958 and 1976 there were three debates between iceland and the united kingdom about the rights to catch codfish

lines.value: johannesson become president of iceland

lines.value: johannesson ) and a prime minister katrin jakobsdottir
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the parliament althing has 63 members and each member can only be in there for four years
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the president is elected by icelanders and is in government for four years
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the president can be elected an unlimited amount of times

lines.value: iceland is divided into 8 regions 6 constituencies and 74 municipalities since 2013
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the regions are mainly used for statistics
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the constituencies are used for selecting politicians who will represent them in parliament
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: lastly the municipalities give services to the people that live there
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these services include education waste management public transportation and so on.before 2003 the constituencies were the same as regions but this was changed because it meant that a vote in reykjavik meant less than one in a rural area
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: even though this was addressed the problem still exists
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: fishing and fish processing is the main economic activity in iceland
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: despite effort to diversify particularly into the travel industry seafood exports continue to account for nearly three quarters of merchandise exports and approximately half of all foreign exchange earnings
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: geothermal energy produces the vast majority of electrical power consumed on iceland due chiefly to the island's position atop the mid atlantic ridge and exhibits plentiful hot water reservoirs and geysers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this has the effect of drastically reducing the price of electricity in iceland and has attracted several energy intensive industries
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: aluminum smelting the reduction of aluminum ores to aluminum metal is the largest energy intensive manufacturing sector in iceland and the country produced over 800000 metric tonnes per year in 2013 making it the 10th largest producer of aluminum metal worldwide
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: iceland is very geologically active and combined with large amounts of rain and snow caused by the warm waters of the gulf stream current which flow toward it many interesting and unusual geographic features have developed which make it different from any other island so close to the arctic circle
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some of these features are iceland's numerous mountains volcanoes hot springs rivers small lakes waterfalls glaciers and geysers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the word geyser is in fact derived from geysir the name of a particularly famous geyser on the southern side of the island
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: glaciers cover approximately 11% of the island and the largest vatnajokull is up to 1 km thick and by far the largest glacier in europe
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: iceland though considered to be a european country sits partly in north america since it straddles the mid atlantic ridge which marks the boundary between the eurasian and north american tectonic plates
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the ridge runs directly through the populated reykjavik and thingvellir historic areas and the tectonic activity of these plates separating is the source of the abundant geothermal energy in the region
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: reykjavik is the capital city of iceland
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: reykjavik is also the most important port in iceland
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: other important towns in iceland are akureyri kopavogur hafnarfjorour keflavik seyoisfjorour and vestmannaeyjar
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: marsupials are the main part of an infraclass of mammals called the metatheria

lines.value: marsupials give birth to living babies

lines.value: the babies feed on milk
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: their babies are born very small
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: marsupials have a special pouch where they carry their babies

lines.value: after the birth the baby goes into its mother's pouch where it can drink milk and is kept warm and safe
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when the babies are young they stay in the pouch all the time but when they are older they can leave it for short times

lines.value: when they are old enough and too big for the pouch they do not go into their mother's pouch anymore

lines.value: marsupials evolved before the southern supercontinent gondwana broke off from pangaea 100 million years ago
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: early marsupial fossils have been found in asia from 125 million years ago
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they were outcompeted on laurasia by placental mammals but the placentals did not get into the australasian part of gondwana before it broke away into a separate supercontinent
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: that is why marsupials now found only on the southern continents of australasia and south and central america with the single exception of the virginia opossum

lines.value: some of the 100 living species of south american marsupials have migrated north 13 species to central america and one to north america
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are 334 species of living australasian marsupials

lines.value: they are mostly in australia and new guinea and some are on the smaller islands

lines.value: in more recent times the land bridge between the americas and reintroductions to australia have brought in placental mammals

lines.value: they have caused the recent extinction of many marsupial species

lines.value: the extinct genus yalkaparidon order yalkaparidontia is a bizarre fossil found in the oligocene/miocene deposits of riversleigh ne australia

lines.value: :a vitamin is also a pill that contains vitamins eaten regularly to keep one healthy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a vitamin is a chemical compound that is needed in small amounts for the human body to work correctly
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they include vitamin a many b vitamins like b 1 b 2 , b 3 , b 6 , and b 12 ), vitamin c vitamin d vitamin e and vitamin k for example citrus fruits such as oranges and lemons contain vitamin c the body does not make these chemicals and needs to get them from other places usually in food
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a short term lack of a certain vitamin is usually not a problem as the body is able to store vitamins for a short time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: not having a certain vitamin for a longer period of time can lead to different diseases depending on the lacking vitamin
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: probably the best known of these diseases is scurvy which results from not having enough vitamin c beriberi and rickets are others
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: today many drug companies make inexpensive pills that contain various vitamins
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they help people avoid those diseases
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: vitamins can be either fat soluble or water soluble
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: fat soluble vitamins a d e and k can be stored in the body and are used when needed
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: water soluble ones only stay in the body a short time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: currently there are no vitamins f to j these existed at some time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: today they are no longer seen as vitamins
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some of them were also false leads and turned out to be something else
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: others were renamed as b vitamins
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: today the b vitamins are a whole complex and not just one vitamin
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the german speaking scientists who isolated and described vitamin k in addition to naming it as such did so because the vitamin is intimately involved in the koagulation clotting of blood following wounding
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at the time most but not all of the letters from f through i were already designated so the use of the letter k was considered quite reasonable
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the following table lists chemicals that had previously been classified as vitamins as well as the earlier names of vitamins that later became part of the b complex
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in cooking a sauce is a liquid mixture added to another food for flavour
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sauces are not normally eaten by themselves they add flavour moisture and visual appeal to another dish
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sauces are an essential element in cuisines all over the world
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the main sauces of french cuisine are built on a basis of roux which is just flour and the liquid part of butter
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: examples from italian cuisine are the egg cheese and ham sauce called carbonara the ground meat sauce called bolognese and the herbs and garlic sauce called pesto
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: bottled sauces can be poured over food when it is served
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: an example would be the tomato based sauce that is usually poured over spaghetti
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: gravy is a brown sauce served with meat
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sauce is a french word taken from the latin salsus meaning salted
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: possibly the oldest sauce recorded is garum the fish sauce used by the romans
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sauces need a liquid component but some sauces for example pico de gallo salsa or chutney may contain more solid elements than liquid
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sauces may be used for savoury dishes or for desserts
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they can be prepared and served cold like mayonnaise prepared cold but served lukewarm like pesto or can be cooked like bechamel and served warm or again cooked and served cold like apple sauce
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some sauces are commercial products like worcestershire sauce hp sauce soy sauce or ketchup
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in french cuisine they are freshly prepared by the chef
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sauces for salads are called salad dressing
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a cook who specializes in making sauces is a saucier
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sauces in french cuisine date back to the middle ages
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there were hundreds of sauces in the culinary repertoire and were a major defining characteristic of french cooking of the 19th and 20th centuries until nouvelle cuisine
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the 19th century the chef antonin careme classified sauces into four families each of which was based on a mother sauce also called grandes sauces
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: careme's four mother sauces were mother sauces are not commonly served as they are instead they are augmented with additional ingredients to make small derivative sauces
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for example bechamel can be made into mornay by the addition of gruyere or any cheese one may like and espagnole becomes bordelaise with the addition and reduction of red wine shallots and poached beef marrow
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: algae one alga but several algae are a type of plant like living things that can make food from sunlight by photosynthesis
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the study of algae is called phycology or algology
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the term lumps together many different kinds of organisms
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they have in common only that they are autotrophic they use natural sources of energy and simple inorganic materials to build their forms
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as non vascular plants they do not have the kind of cell and tissue structure of land plants
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they are a convenient but very loose term
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: only in recent years has it become clear how different the many kinds of algae are
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: algae are a large and diverse group of simple typically autotrophic organisms
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some have one cell and others have many cells
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the largest and most complex marine algae are called seaweeds
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they are like plants and simple because they lack the many distinct organs found in land plants
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for that reason they are not classified as plants
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: though the prokaryotic cyanobacteria formerly referred to as blue green algae were included as algae in older textbooks it is not now
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the term algae is now used for eukaryotic organisms
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: all true algae have a nucleus within a membrane and chloroplasts inside one or more membranes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however algae are definitely not a monophyletic group as they do not all descend from a common algal ancestor
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: modern taxonomists propose splitting them up into monophyletic groups but not everyone agrees how to do this
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: algae do not have the same structures that land plants do such as leaves roots and other organs
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: nearly all algae have parts that do photosynthesis the same way as cyanobacteria
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they make oxygen unlike other photosynthetic bacteria such as purple and green bacteria
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some unicellular species use only external energy sources and have limited or no photosynthetic parts
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: fossilized filamentous algae from the vindhya basin have been dated back to 1.6 to 1.7 billion years ago
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: algae are usually found in damp places or water and are common on land and water
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however algae on land are usually inconspicuous and are far more common in moist tropical regions than dry ones
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: algae do not have vascular tissues and other adaptations to live on land but they can endure dryness and other conditions in symbiosis with a fungus as lichen
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the various sorts of algae play significant roles in aquatic ecology
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: microscopic forms that live suspended in the water column are called phytoplankton
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they provide the food base for most marine food chains
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: kelp grows mostly in shallow marine waters
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some are used as human food or harvested for agar or fertilizer
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: kelp can grow in large stands called kelp forests
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these forests prevent some of the damage from waves
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many different species live in them including sea urchins sea otters and abalone
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some algae may harm other species
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some algae may reproduce a lot and make an algal bloom
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these algae may make protective toxins which can kill fish in the water
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: dinoflagellates make a compound that turns the flesh of fish into slime
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: then the algae eats this nutritious liquid
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: algae have evolved a number of symbiotic partnerships with other organisms
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the most famous is the plant like lichen which are each formed by a fungus with an alga
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is a highly successful life form and twenty thousand species are known
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in all cases the lichen are quite different in appearance and life style from either constituent it is possibly the most complete symbiosis known
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: both constituents gain from their access to niches with low nutrient value which is where lichen are found
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: less well known are the algal relationships with animals
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: reef building corals are basically social cnidarian polyps
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: corals are dependent on light because the algae are important partners and they require light
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: corals have evolved structures often tree like which offer the algae maximum access to light
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the coral weakens the algal cell walls and digests about 80% of the food synthesised by the algae
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the corals waste products provide nutrients for the algae so as with lichen both partners gain from the association
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the algae are golden brown flagellate algae often of the genus symbiodinium
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a curious feature of the partnership is that the coral may eject the algae in hard times and regain them later
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the ejection of the algal partner is called bleaching because the coral loses its colour
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: p200 other types of cnideria such as sea anemones and jellyfish also contain algae
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: jellyfish with algae behave so that their partners get the best light during the day and descend to depths at night where the water is rich in nitrates and brown with decay
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sea slugs and clams are also well known for harbouring algae
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: both groups are molluscs
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the sea slugs graze on coral and are the same colour as the coral they graze
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they are able to separate the algae from the polyp tissues they digest
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the algal cells are moved to its tentacles where they continue to live
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the otherwise defenceless slug gains both camouflage and nutrition
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: p204 the giant clam keeps algae in its mantle which is revealed when the clam is open
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the coloured mantle has places where the skin is transparent and acts like a lens to concentrate light on the algae beneath
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when the algae get too numerous the clam digests them
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: p203 various other marine invertebrate groups have members which symbiose with algae
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: flatworms platyhelminths and polychaete worms annelids are two such groups
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: body piercing or just piercing is a form of body modification where humans of either gender their skin to put jewellery through the hole later
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are many different reasons some people have piercings such as religious or other cultural purposes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many people especially in north america and europe choose to be pierced for ornamental or sexual pleasure
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in early records it was not common to discuss the use of piercings or their meanings
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however body adornment and modification are have been around for more than 5000 years found in mummies like otzi the iceman europe's oldest natural mummy to be about 5300 years old
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: piercing of the ears nose and tongue have a long history in many ancient cultures and lip piercing and stretching were more common in african tribes especially for cultural identification
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: body piercings of any kind were not popular in western cultures in the beginning of the 20th century
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after world war ii the gay subculture used piercings as a fashion statement
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: other subcultures such as hippie and the punk movement also began to use piercings as a form of expression in the 1960s and 1970s
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: genital piercing is becoming more common
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sometimes people get genital piercings to create interest or attract attention
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some types of genital piercing are supposed to increase sexual pleasure
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: mahjong is a game for four players that was created in china
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is a game of skill intelligence calculation and luck
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a mahjong game is played at a square table four sides all the same length
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the dealer is called the east player and everyone else is called a different direction because of where they are sitting so the person to east's left is south the person across from east is west and the person to east's right is north
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if east wins he is the dealer again for the next round if he does not the dealer is the person to his right north
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: that person then becomes east
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a game of mahjong ends when every player has been the dealer four times or when they have played the number of rounds they said they would play before they started
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a single player version of this game exists called mahjong solitaire
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is based on the four player game but can be played by one person so it is one of the games that are played often on computers such as solitaire spider solitaire or minesweeper
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: mahjong solitaire is much simpler than four player mahjong it is played without dice or chips by removing tiles set up in the shape of a pyramid from the board in sets of two
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: each set of two has to match they are either exactly the same or go together two flowers tiles for example
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a mahjong solitaire player wins when he picks up all the tiles or he loses when he runs out of sets of two that he can pick up
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: william edgar bill oddie obe born 7 july 1941 is a british comedian actor writer and television personality

lines.value: oddie was born in rochdale lancashire and grew up in birmingham

lines.value: he read english literature at pembroke college cambridge where he gained an ma he is most famous for his birdwatching and conservation work

lines.value: in the 1970s he was a member of the bbc one television comedy series the goodies
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: doctors found that his mother lilian had schizophrenia

lines.value: oddie says that he does not remember her living at home because she spent a lot of her life in mental hospitals

lines.value: oddie has bipolar disorder

lines.value: muhammad ali jinnah also spelled mohammad 25 december 1876 - 11 september 1948 in karachi present day pakistan is the founder of pakistan
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after the partition of india he became the governor general of pakistan
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as a mark of respect pakistanis call him quaid e azam
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: is a phrase which in the urdu language means the great leader
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: people also called him , another phrase in the urdu language which means the father of the nation
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the day of his birth is a national holiday in pakistan
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: muhammad ali jinnah was born on 25 december 1876 in karachi into a kasana family of ismaili shia islam
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at home his family talked in gujarati language and the children also came to speak kutchi and english
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: except for fatima little is known of his siblings
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: jinnah's birth name was mahomed ali jinnahbhai
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: .he later changed it to the much simpler muhammad ali jinnah or ma jinnah
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was born in jhirk city of sindh province of pakistan
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his date of birth is 25 december 1876
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his father's name was jinnah poonja 1857 1901 and his mother's name was mithibai
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: jinnah was the eldest of the seven children of jinnah poonja and mithibai
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his family had migrated to sindh from the kathiawar area of gujarat india
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1891 when he was fifteen jinnah went to london and worked for few years for a company
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: before going to london he was married to emibai
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she was his distant relative
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at the time of her marriage emibai was around 14 or 16 years old
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: but emibai died shortly after jinnah had gone to london
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at around the same time his mother also died
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1894 jinnah quit his job to study law
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he joined the course at lincoln's inn and graduated in 1896
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: while still in london he also started to participate in politics
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he greatly admired indian political leaders dadabhai naoroji and sir pherozeshah mehta
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: gradually jinnah was developing his own political outlook
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was thinking on the line that india should have a constitutional self government
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: around this time his father lost his business
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this put jinnah under great difficulty
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the meantime he had started to practice as a lawyer in mumbai
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he also built a house in mumbai's malabar hill area
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the house is now known as jinnah house
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he became a successful lawyer
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1908 he represented bal gangadhar tilak a famous leader of the indian national congress
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: tilak was facing charges of sedition against the british raj
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: jinnah pleaded the case well but tilak was sent to prison
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: jinnah had already joined the indian national congress in 1906
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the congress was the largest political organization in india
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many members and leaders of the indian national congress favoured a limited self government for india
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: jinnah also held the same view
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at that time his role model was gopal krishna gokhale
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on 25 january 1910 jinnah became a member on the sixty member imperial legislative council
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was an active member of the council
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: like many other leaders of india jinnah also supported great britain during world war i the leaders had supported the great britain thinking that after the war great britain would grant india political freedom
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at the beginning jinnah had avoided joining the all india muslim league another political organization of india
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: muslims had formed the league in 1906
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1913 jinnah became a member of the muslim league
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1916 he became the president of the muslim league
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he helped in making an agreement between the congress and the muslim league(lucknow pact in 1916
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the agreement tried to present a united front to the british for giving india self government dominion status in the british empire
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this was similar to the dominion status which canada new zealand and australia had at that time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1918 jinnah married again
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his second wife was rattanbai petit
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she was twenty four years younger than him
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she was the daughter of jinnah's personal friend sir dinshaw petit who belonged to the parsi zoroastrian community
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many parsis and muslims did not like marriage between persons of two religions
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the jinnah couple resided in bombay now mumbai and frequently travelled to europe
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1919 his wife bore a daughter who was named dina
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: by 1918 mohandas gandhi had become one of the main leaders of the congress party
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: gandhi took a line of non violent protest for gaining self government for india
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: jinnah took a different line
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he wanted constitutional struggle to gain the self government for india
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: jinnah also opposed gandhi's support for the khilafat movement
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: gradually many differences between them had arisen
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1920 jinnah left the congress party
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he became the president of the muslim league
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at this time jinnah brought out a program to reduce the differences between the congress party and the muslim league
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the program had fourteen points of action
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: therefore it became popularly known as jinnah's fourteen points
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: but the congress party did not accept these
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: during these years jinnah's personal life had suffered
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his focus upon politics had led to tensions in jinnah's marriage.the couple separated in 1927 and after a serious illness rattanbai died
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: around that time there was a conference of indian leaders with the government of great britain
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was held in london and is known as the round table conference
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: jinnah criticized the policy of gandhi
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the conference failed
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: jinnah was also not happy with the muslim league
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he decided to quit politics
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he again started to work as a lawyer in england
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: during all these years his sister fatima jinnah took care of jinnah's affairs both at home and outside
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she also became a close adviser to him
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she helped him in raising jinnah's daughter dina wadia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the daughter married neville wadia a parasi who had converted to christianity
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: jinnah did not like this marriage but continued to correspond with his daughter
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many muslim leaders of india like aga khan iii coudhary rahmat ali and sir muhammad iqbal requested jinnah to come back to india
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the leaders of the muslim league wanted him to take charge of the muslim league
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: jinnah agreed to come back to india
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1934 he left london and returned to india to reorganize the muslim league again
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: but he could not revive the stature of the party until after the elections of 1937 as the muslim league won only a few seats
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however at this time the league was helped by the powerful premier of the punjab sir sikandar hayat khan
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on october 1937 he agreed with jinnah's muslim league joining his strong government
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this was called the jinnah sikandar pact
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his differences with the congress party continued to become bigger
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1930 some muslim leaders like allama iqbal had argued for a separate country for the muslim people of india
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at last he came to the conclusion that hindus and muslims cannot live in a single country
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: jinnah also started to have the idea of a separate country for muslims of india
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: jinnah and the muslim league started work to get such a separate country

lines.value: they made a plan for this in 1940 called the pakistan resolution

lines.value: an article is a word that comes before a noun
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are two kinds of articles definite articles and indefinite articles
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in english there is just one definite article the
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are two indefinite articles a and an
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the word an is used before a word starting with a vowel sound we say a horse a child a european euro has a y sound a university but an orange an elephant
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some languages have more than one word for the
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in some languages this is because each noun is either masculine or feminine or in some languages it can be masculine feminine or neuter
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for example in french le is used for masculine nouns le jardin the garden and la for feminine nouns la table the table
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the becomes les in front of plural nouns

lines.value: the indefinite articles in french are un masculine and une feminine

lines.value: german dutch and ancient greek have masculine feminine and neuter nouns but in the case of dutch the word for the is the same for masculine and feminine de so you do not need to know which it is

lines.value: the maori language uses one word for the for when the subject or object to which the the refers is one in number and uses another word for the when the subject or object to which the the refers numbers more than one

lines.value: some languages for example russian and japanese do not have articles

lines.value: when speakers of these languages are learning english it is often difficult to explain to them what an article is

lines.value: english speakers use them automatically

lines.value: the words nature and natural are used for all the things that are normally not made by humans

lines.value: the copyright law is a law that gives the owner of a written musical composition book picture or other creative work the right to decide what other people can do with it
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: copyright laws make it easier for authors to make money by selling their works
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: because of copyright a work can only be copied if the owner of the copyright gives
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when someone copies or edits a work that is protected under copyright without permission the owner may sue for the value of the violation
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most such cases are handled by civil law
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in more serious cases a person who copies a work that is protected under copyright could be arrested fined or even go to prison
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in most countries authors automatically own the copyright to any work they make or create as long as they do not give the copyright to someone else
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in most countries there is no need to register the copyright and some countries do not even have procedures to register copyrights
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: but where registration is available many authors register anyway especially for works that are sold for money
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: that is because registration helps to that the copyright of a work belongs to a certain author
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if an author gets paid to make a work for someone else the person who pays for making the work for example the author's employer will often get to own the copyright instead of the author him herself
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for example if a person working for a company like microsoft creates a new computer software program at work the microsoft company would own the copyright
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: copyright laws usually protect owners of copyright beyond their lifetime such as until 50 years after the author's death
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in some countries this period has been extended to 70 years
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when the period of copyright protection has ended the written document musical composition book picture or other creative work is in the public domain
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this means that no one owns the copyright and everyone is free to copy use and change them without having to ask for permission or pay the owner
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there is an to the rules of copyright called fair use
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this means that people can copy a very small amount of a work to use in reviews or in research reports
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: an example of fair use is when newspaper writers several sentences from a copyright protected document to tell the story
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: another example of fair use is when a university professor quotes several sentences from a copyright protected book in a review of the book or in a research report
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: different countries have different copyright laws
lines.name: Simple English

lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some people argue that copyright laws make it easier for people to make new works and think of new ideas

lines.value: after all if authors get to make money for the time effort and money they put in then they will want to make more works later and make more money
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: but others believe that copyright laws make it harder to be creative
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: without copyright other people could reuse existing work and copyright law often stops that
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if an author wants to sell a work it's often easiest to give the copyright to a publisher
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the publisher will do all the selling and in return for that service will keep part of the money
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: but the publisher has many different things to sell and they may not want to sell the work the author made
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: authors often find it very hard to find a publisher willing to sell their work
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: but without a publisher it can be even harder for an author to sell his or her work
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in many markets a few big publishers own the copyrights to almost everything available and stores will not want to sell works published by small authors themselves

lines.value: many people say copyright law helps big publishers stay in control and keeps smaller authors out of the market

lines.value: [11][12] saudi arabia is sometimes called the land of the two holy mosques in reference to al masjid al haram in mecca and al masjid an nabawi in medina the two holiest places in islam

lines.value: saudi arabia has the world's largest petroleum reserves and is the world's largest oil exporter

lines.value: the area of modern day saudi arabia formerly consisted of four distinct regions hejaz najd and parts of eastern arabia al-ahsa and southern arabia asir
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: [10] the kingdom of saudi arabia was founded in 1932 by ibn saud
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he united the four regions into a single state through a series of conquests beginning in 1902 with the capture of riyadh the ancestral home of his family the house of saud
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the country has since been an absolute monarchy governed along islamic lines
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the kingdom of saudi arabia was founded by abdul aziz bin saud known for most of his career as ibn saud in 1932
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the conquests which eventually led to the creation of the kingdom began in 1902 when he captured riyadh the ancestral home of his family the house of saud
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the saudi arabian government which is an absolute monarchy refers to its system of government as being islamic
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it has a strong basis in wahhabism a minority school of thought in islam
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the kingdom is sometimes called the land of the two holy mosques in reference to masjid al haram in mecca and masjid al nabawi in medina the two holiest places in islam
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: saudi arabia is an absolute monarchy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however according to the basic law of saudi arabia adopted by royal decree in 1992 the king must comply with sharia islamic law and the quran while the quran and the sunnah the traditions of muhammad are declared to be the country's constitution
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the primary source of law is the islamic sharia derived from the teachings of the qur'an and the sunnah the traditions of the prophet
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: saudi arabia is unique among modern muslim states in that sharia is not codified and there is no system of judicial precedent giving judges the power to use independent legal reasoning to make a decision
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: saudi judges tend to follow the principles of the hanbali school of jurisprudence or fiqh found in pre modern texts and noted for its literalist interpretation of the qur'an and hadith
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: because the judge is empowered to disregard previous judgments either his own or of other judges and may apply his personal interpretation of sharia to any particular case divergent judgements arise even in apparently identical cases making predictability of legal interpretation difficult
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the sharia court system constitutes the basic judiciary of saudi arabia and its judges qadi and lawyers form part of the ulema the country's islamic scholars
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: royal decrees are the other main source of law but are referred to as regulations rather than laws because they are subordinate to the sharia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: royal decrees supplement sharia in areas such as labor commercial and corporate law
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: additionally traditional tribal law and custom remain significant
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: extra sharia government tribunals usually handle disputes relating to specific royal decrees
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: final appeal from both sharia courts and government tribunals is to the king and all courts and tribunals follow sharia rules of evidence and procedure
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a hijab is a traditional islamic norm whereby women are required to draw their outer garments around them when they go out or are among men and dress in a modest manner

lines.value: italy used to be many different smaller countries
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: between 1815 1871 italy started to form these smaller states and became one country the kingdom of italy led by vittorio emanuele ii of italy called victor emanuel ii in english
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: starting around 1848 nationalism and patriotism became popular throughout europe
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many people wanted the smaller countries with similar culture language or ethnicity to join together
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this resulted in two major countries being formed
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the first was italy in the italian unification
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the second was germany in the german unification

lines.value: risorgimento also called italian unification or unification of italy or the resurgence refers to the italian movement for independence
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: risorgimento literally means resurgence in the italian language
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the movement truly began in 1848 when there were many revolts occurring throughout italy after klemens wenzel von metternich lost his office of austrian chancellor
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the movement for independence succeeded in 1859 through the efforts of count cavour the piedmontese prime minister as well as giuseppe garibaldi
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: an italian national hero who united the south which allowed king victor emmanuel to become the first king of italy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: napoleon invaded italy in 1796 and later controlled it but when he was defeated in 1815 in the battle of waterloo
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it became possible for the now free states to join together
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: victor emmanuel of piedmont sardinia saw a great vision of a unified italy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he wanted piedmont sardinia to be a model for the unification of italy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: to do so he started many public works projects and political reforms
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: piedmont sardinia was soon recognized as an emerging power
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the next step for piedmont sardinia s conquest was to get austria out of the italian peninsula
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: with the crimean war breaking out between france and britain on one side and russia on the other piedmont sardinia saw a chance to earn some respect and make a name for itself
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: britain and france proved victorious and sardinia was able to attend the peace conference
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as a result of this piedmont sardinia gained the support of napoleon iii
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1858 sardinia and france secretly plotted a plan of attack against austria
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the following year sardinia put its plan into action and provoked austria into declaring war on sardinia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: by sardinia's encouraging nationalist revolts in austrian held territories in italy austria was provoked into the war
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: following the battles of magenta and solferino france drove austria out of lombardy but austria still held onto venetia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at this point france dropped out of the war fearing a unified italy might be a threat as well as realising that austrian strength would eventually crush them
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this ended the war with austria keeping venetia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: meanwhile the italian nationalist giuseppe garibaldi led a nationalist uprising combining the states and territories into a full republic
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as sardinia ended the war garibaldi gave most of the provinces to sardinia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in march 1861 a parliament of all of italy except rome and venetia agreed on unifying italy with victor emmanuel as its first king

lines.value: wikimedia commons is a website owned by the wikimedia foundation based on a wiki
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: anybody can upload images sounds videos and other multimedia files to the website
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the files uploaded to wikimedia commons can be used by any other wikimedia foundation project like wikipedia or wiktionary
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for example wikipedia uses images on wikimedia commons to include pictures in their encyclopedia articles
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: other websites based on wikis can also use files from wikimedia commons even if they are unrelated to the wikimedia foundation
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: wikimedia commons has categories which are groups of files that have something in common or similar
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for example there is a category for pictures of cats
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: wikimedia commons is a multilingual website meaning that it can be used in every language
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however some parts of wikimedia commons are only in english like names of categories
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: wikimedia commons also has sound files
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: not all of these are music
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for example there are recordings that read words out loud
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these files are used in wiktionary a free dictionary to teach people how to say words
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for every file on wikimedia commons the person who made it has to let everybody use it and change it as much as they want including companies see creative commons
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many files are public domain but others must not be used without the permission of the people who made them because that would break copyright laws
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: wikimedia commons reached 10 million files on april 15 2011
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the wikimedia foundation was given money to make it easier for people to use their websites
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they used some of this money to make the uploadwizard a new system for uploading files on wikimedia commons
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: people started using the uploadwizard in december 2010
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the uploadwizard also teaches new uploaders about copyright law
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it has a tutorial for users to read so that they can check if the file they are uploading is violating copyright
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most uploads are by the uploadwizard
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: before wikimedia commons only let people upload one file at a time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the uploadwizard lets people upload multiple files at the same time and include all the required information about each one
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the logo of wikimedia commons has a red circle inside a blue circle
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are many small blue arrows pointing from the blue circle to the red circle in the middle and one big blue arrow pointing upwards
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the small blue arrows represent the different projects of the wikimedia foundation
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the large arrow is to show that wikimedia commons is constantly improving
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this logo was chosen in a vote in 2004
