lines.value: neutrons with protons and electrons make up an atom
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: neutrons and protons are found in the nucleus of an atom
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: unlike protons which have a positive charge or electrons which have a negative charge neutrons have zero charge which means they are neutral particles
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: neutrons bind with protons with the residual strong force
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: neutrons were predicted by ernest rutherford and discovered by james chadwick in 1932
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: atoms were fired at a thin pane of beryllium
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: particles emerged which had no charge and he called these neutrons
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they were later added to the modern image of the atom
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: neutrons have a mass of 1.675 x 10 -24 g which is a little heavier than the proton
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: neutrons are 1839 times heavier than electrons
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: like all hadrons neutrons are made of quarks
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a neutron is made of two down quarks and one up quark
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: one up quark has a charge of +2/3 and the two down quarks each have a charge of -1/3
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the fact that these charges cancel out is why neutrons have a neutral 0 charge
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: quarks are held together by gluons
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: neutrons can be found in almost all atoms together with protons and electrons
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: hydrogen 1 is the only exception
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: atoms with the same number of protons but a different number of neutrons are called isotopes of the same element
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the number of neutrons in an atom does not affect its chemical properties
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however it affects its half life a measure of its stability
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: an unstable isotope has a short half life in which half of it decays to lighter elements
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: by contrast a stable isotope has a long half life much longer than that of an unstable isotope
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the stability of an isotope is related to radioactivity an unstable isotope can be highly radioactive
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: neutrons are the key to nuclear chain reactions nuclear power and nuclear weapons

lines.value: mikhail ivanovich glinka 1804-1857 was a russian composer regarded as the first to become very famous
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: russia is a very large country
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the 18th century there was a lot of music in europe but russian people had not yet heard it
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a lot of them were very poor and modern transport did not exist
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: by the time glinka was born russian people in the large towns like saint petersburg were becoming very interested in european music
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: mikhail glinka was born in a little village called novospasskoye
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his father was a rich landowner
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: glinka was brought up by his grandmother who looked after him very carefully
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she was always afraid he would be cold so she wrapped him up in a fur coat in a room which was kept at 77 °f
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was not often allowed to play in the fresh air
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: later in his life glinka was always worrying about his health
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was a long way to the big cities from where the child lived
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there was no radio in those days and no cds
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the only music he heard was the church bells and the singing of the peasants the simple people who worked on the land
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they sang folksongs and made up harmony underneath the tunes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after his grandmother died he was allowed to travel 6 miles to his uncle's home
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his uncle had a group of musicians who played music by european composers like haydn mozart and beethoven
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he had never heard such music before
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when he was 13 he went to school in st petersburg
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: now he could hear lots of music and meet some good musicians
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he had piano lessons and spent a lot of time at parties
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he started to compose some songs
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1830 he went to italy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: italy was famous for its music especially for opera
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: glinka met famous composers like mendelssohn and berlioz as well as italian composers like donizetti and bellini
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he like their music and decided he wanted to write opera as well but he wanted to make his music sound very russian
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: glinka went back to russia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he wrote two great operas
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the first one was called ivan susanin
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the story of the opera set in 1612 is about a poor peasant ivan susanin who dies to save the life of the tsar the tsar was the ruler of russia like a king or emperor
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the tsar liked the opera and thought that it should be called a life for the tsar
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was a big success when it was first performed in 1836
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he soon wrote his second opera ruslan and lyudmila
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the story comes from a tale by the famous russian poet pushkin
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the man who wrote the words for him did it very quickly while he was drunk so the story is a bit muddled but the music is wonderful
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is a fairy tale about a nasty dwarf chernomor who has taken away a princess called lyudmila
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the end ruslan the hero rescues her
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some of the music sounds quite oriental
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the overture that starts the opera is very famous
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: glinka also wrote piano music songs and chamber music
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: glinka's music is important because he was the first russian composer to write music that sounded russian
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: later composers like tchaikovsky were influenced by his music
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: accountancy or accounting is the job of sharing financial information about a business to managers and shareholders people who have invested in the business
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: accounting is often called the language of business
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: accountants are people who do accounting and also carry out the auditing or checking of a company's books and records
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in britain this auditing is often carried out by a qualified person called a chartered accountant
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when accountants do accounting work they write in the books of account ledgers that belong to a company
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: every time money is spent or it is written in the ledger
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the information in the ledger is used to prepare the company accounts monthly quarterly every three months and annually every year
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these annual accounts show what money the company has taken in over time and what it has spent money on
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it also shows if the company made a profit in the year if it made more money than it spent who owes the company money who the company owes money to and any big expensive items the company has bought which they expect to use for many years
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: lenders managers investors tax authorities the people who collect taxes for the government and other decision makers look at these annual accounts
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: managers and investors look at the ledger and make decisions about how to spend money in the future
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: lenders like banks look at the accounts before they lend money to the company
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: tax authorities look at them to check that the company is paying the correct amount of taxes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the word accountant originally comes from the latin word computare - "to reckon count number via french
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: accomptant was the original spelling and pronunciation of the word accountant
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however over time people began to drop the p in the word accomptant
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: over time the word changed both in the way it was said and spelled to how it is today
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the basic accounting equation is assets=liabilities+equity
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: accountancy is very old
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it started when humans first started to farm and form towns and cities
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: people who thought about economics keeping track of money and valuable things thought of a way to write down the sizes and values of crops
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the earliest accounting records were found among the ruins of ancient babylon assyria and sumeria which are more than 7000 years old
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the people of that time relied on primitive accounting methods to record the growth of crops and herds
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: because there is a natural season for farming and herding it is easy to count and determine if a surplus had been gained after the crops had been harvested or the young animals weaned
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the invention of a form of bookkeeping using clay tokens represented a huge cognitive leap for mankind
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the twelfth century ad the arab writer ibn taymiyyah wrote a book called hisba
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this book has details about accounting systems that were used by muslims before the mid seventh century ad muslim accounting was influenced changed by romans and persians
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in his book ibn taymiyyah gives details of a complex governmental accounting system
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the res gestae divi augusti latin the deeds of the divine augustus is a remarkable account to the roman people of the emperor augustus stewardship
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it listed and quantified his public expenditure which encompassed distributions to the people grants of land or money to army veterans subsidies to the aerarium treasury building of temples religious offerings and expenditures on theatrical shows and gladiatorial games
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was not an account of state revenue and expenditure but was designed to demonstrate augustus munificence
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the significance of the res gestae divi augusti from an accounting perspective lies in the fact that it illustrates that the executive authority had access to detailed financial information covering a period of some forty years which was still retrievable after the event
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the scope of the accounting information at the emperor's disposal suggests that its purpose encompassed planning and decision making
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the roman historians suetonius and cassius dio record that in 23 bc augustus prepared a rationarium account which listed public revenues the amounts of cash in the aerarium treasury in the provincial fisci tax officials and in the hands of the publicani public contractors and that it included the names of the freedmen and slaves from whom a detailed account could be obtained
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the closeness of this information to the executive authority of the emperor is attested by tacitus statement that it was written out by augustus himself
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: records of cash commodities and transactions were kept scrupulously by military personnel of the roman army
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: an account of small cash sums received over a few days at the fort of vindolanda circa 110 ce shows that the fort could compute revenues in cash on a daily basis perhaps from sales of surplus supplies or goods manufactured in the camp items dispensed to slaves such as cervesa beer and clavi caligares nails for boots as well as commodities bought by individual soldiers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the basic needs of the fort were met by a mixture of direct production purchase and requisition in one letter a request for money to buy 5000 modii measures of braces a cereal used in brewing shows that the fort bought provisions for a considerable number of people
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the heroninos archive is the name given to a huge collection of papyrus documents mostly letters but also including a fair number of accounts which come from roman egypt in 3rd century ce
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the bulk of the documents relate to the running of a large private estate is named after heroninos because he was phrontistes koine greek manager of the estate which had a complex and standarised system of accounting which was followed by all its local farm managers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: each administrator on each sub division of the estate drew up his own little accounts for the day to day running of the estate payment of the workforce production of crops the sale of produce the use of animals and general expenditure on the staff
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this information was then summarized as pieces of papyrus scroll into one big yearly account for each particular sub division of the estate
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: entries were arranged by sector with cash expenses and gains extrapolated from all the different sectors
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: accounts of this kind gave the owner the opportunity to take better economic decisions because the information was purposefully selected and arranged
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: luca pacioli 1445-1517 also known as friar luca dal borgo is said to be the father of accountancy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he wrote a textbook in latin called summa de arithmetica geometrica proportioni et proportionalita summa on arithmetic geometry proportions and proportionality venice 1494
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this textbook was used in the abbaco schools in northern italy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sons of merchants and craftsmen were taught in these schools
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this textbook was written about math
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it has the first printed description of how merchants from venice kept their accounts
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: merchants from venice used a system called the double entry bookkeeping system
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: double entry bookkeeping is where there is a debit and credit entry for every transaction
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: pacioli wrote down this system but he did not invent it but he is still called the father of accounting
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the system he wrote had most of the accounting cycle as it is known today
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he wrote about using journals and ledgers and warned that a person should not go to sleep at night until the debits were the same as the credits
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his ledger had accounts for assets things that have value liabilities debts and loans that are to be paid to someone else capital money income and expenses
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he showed how to write year end closing entries and suggested that a trial balance be used to prove that a ledger is balanced
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his treatise long essay in the book also has info about other topics such as accounting ethics and cost accounting
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the first book written in the english language on accounting was published in london england by john gouge in 1543
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1588 john mellis from southwark england wrote a short book of instructions for keeping accounts
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there was another book written in 1635 that was described as the merchants mirrour or directions for the perfect ordering and keeping of his accounts formed by way of debitor and creditor
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this book was written by richard dafforne who was an accountant
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this book has many references to books about accountancy that were written much earlier
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a microorganism or microbe is an organism which is microscopic making it too small to be seen by the unaided human eye
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the study of microorganisms is called microbiology
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: microorganisms include bacteria fungi archaea protists and viruses
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the first of these four types of microorganisms may either be free living or parasitic
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: viruses can only be parasitic since they always reproduce inside other living things
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most micro organisms are single celled or unicellular organisms but there are unicellular protists that are visible to the human eye and some multicellular species are microscopic
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: microorganisms live almost everywhere on earth where there is liquid water including hot springs on the ocean floor and deep inside rocks within the earth's crust
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: such habitats are lived in by extremophiles
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: microorganisms are critical to nutrient recycling in ecosystems because they act as decomposers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: because some microorganisms can also take nitrogen out of the air they are an important part of the nitrogen cycle
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: pathogenic or harmful microbes can invade other organisms and cause disease
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: free living microbes get their energy in many different ways
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some use photosynthesis like plants do
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some break down natural chemicals in their environment
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: others feed on things that were once living such as fallen leaves and dead animals causing them to breakdown or decay
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some fungi and bacteria cause food to decay
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: moldy bread or fruit sour milk and rotten meat are examples of decayed food
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in nature decayed materials mix with soil providing essential nutrients for plants to use
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: without this process the nutrients in the soil would run out
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these types of organisms are called decomposers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they are the natural recyclers of living things on our planet
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: microbes also help us make some of our foods such as bread cheese yogurt beer and wine
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they feed on the sugar in grain fruit or milk giving these foods a special texture and taste
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some microbes often called germs cause illness or disease
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they are parasites which live by invading living things
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: chickenpox mumps and measles are all caused by viruses
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they are infectious diseases
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: certain bacteria cause tooth decay
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is possible to protect humans against some harmful microbes by storing and preparing food properly cleaning the teeth washing hands and by avoiding close contact with ill people
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: all animals seem to have bacteria and protozoa living in or on them without doing much harm
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sometimes as with herbivores the microorganisms are vital to the digestion of food
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the human gut has more organisms living inside it than there are cells in the human body

lines.value: a time limit is a time horizon that is imposed on everyone at once

lines.value: it may be used to try to achieve fairness in some system of ethics
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for instance if poor people and rich people are debating something a time limit may be imposed so that the rich people cannot keep debating until the poor people have to go to work and lose

lines.value: the society of friends began in the 1650's in england

lines.value: a man named george fox spent several years struggling to figure out how to be a good christian
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he finally heard god's voice telling him that christ would make it clear to him what he should do

lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: fox found other people who had similar experiences

lines.value: together they started a religious movement that later became the religious society of friends

lines.value: the government of england did not like this new group at the time it was against the law not to belong to the church of england

lines.value: they put a lot of friends in jail or made them pay money as a punishment

lines.value: quaker worship services are called meetings for worship

lines.value: they start with everybody sitting quietly
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is because they are trying to listen to god

lines.value: sometimes a quaker will feel that god wants him or her to say something

lines.value: when this happens the person stands up and tells everyone

lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: quakers feel that a meeting for worship helps them to understand what god wants

lines.value: usually worship lasts about an hour

lines.value: anyone can go to a quaker meeting
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: quakers also have meetings for worship for weddings and funerals when two people get married or if someone dies

lines.value: when two people get married the meeting is about them and the life that they will live together
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when someone has died the meeting is about remembering things about the person and the life they had

lines.value: and at other times these meetings also decide what quakers should do these meetings can be called meetings for business but other people call them meetings for worship for business because they include parts of both worship and business

lines.value: general relativity is a theory of space and time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the theory was published by albert einstein in 1915
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the central idea of general relativity is that space and time are two aspects of spacetime
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: spacetime is curved when there is gravity matter energy and momentum
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the links between these forces are shown in the einstein field equations
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a central idea in general relativity is the principle of equivalence an example is that two people one in an elevator sitting on the surface of the earth and the other in an elevator in outer space accelerating at 9.8 m s 2 will each observe the same behavior of an object they drop from their hand
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the object will accelerate to the floor at 9.8 m s 2 in either case making it impossible for either to distinguish whether or not they are at rest in a gravitational field or accelerating upward at one
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: other versions of this type of thought experiment were used to show that light would curve in an accelerating frame of reference
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are several forms of the equivalence principle
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these include newton's equivalence principle the weak equivalence principle the gravitational weak equivalence principle einstein's equivalence principle and the strong equivalence principle
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the sun can be seen as this kind of valley in spacetime and one of the other objects in the valley is the earth
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the earth does not roll directly towards the sun or ball because it is moving too fast
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the force pulling the earth towards the sun is about the same as a second force
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this second force is called the centrifugal force
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the centrifugal force exists because the earth moves sideways
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this sideways motion makes the distance between the earth and sun increase
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: since the earth is being pulled towards the sun and moving away at the same time it stays at about the same distance
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is also how the moon orbits the earth
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in this second case earth is the ball and the moon is the object
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: general relativity has predicted many things which were later seen
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these include
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the milky way is our home galaxy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it contains over 200 billion stars including our sun
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the milky way has a diameter of 100000 light years and is a barred spiral galaxy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the idea that the milky way is made of stars goes back to the ancient greek philosopher democritus
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the milky way has three main parts a disk in which the solar system resides a bulge at the core and an all encompassing halo
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this galaxy belongs to the local group of three large galaxies and over 50 smaller galaxies
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the milky way is one of the largest galaxies in the group second to the andromeda galaxy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: milky way's closest neighbour is canis major dwarf which is about 25000 light years away from the earth
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the andromeda galaxy moves towards the milky way galaxy and will meet it in about 3.75 billion years
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: andromeda galaxy moves with a speed of about 1800 kilometres per minute
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the stellar disk of the milky way galaxy is approximately 100000 light years 9x10 17 km in diameter and is considered to be on average about 1000 light years thick
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is estimated to contain at least 200 billion stars and possibly up to 400 billion stars
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the figure depends on the number of very low mass or dwarf stars which are hard to detect especially more than 300 light years from our sun
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: therefore present estimates of the total number are uncertain
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this can be compared to the one trillion 10 12 ) stars of the neighbouring andromeda galaxy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the stellar disc of the milky way does not have a sharp edge a radius beyond which there are no stars
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: rather the number of stars drops smoothly with distance from the centre of the galaxy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: beyond a radius of about 40000 light years the number of stars drops much faster for reasons that are not understood
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: extending beyond the stellar disk is a much thicker disk of gas
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: recent observations indicate that the gaseous disk of the milky way has a thickness of around 12000 light years twice the previously accepted value
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as a guide to the relative physical scale of the milky way if the solar system out to the orbit of pluto were reduced to the size of a us quarter about an inch or 25 mm in diameter the milky way would have a diameter of 2000 kilometers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at 220 kilometers per second it takes the solar system about 240 million years to complete one orbit of the galaxy a galactic year
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the galactic halo extends outward but is limited in size by the orbits of two milky way satellites the large and the small magellanic clouds whose closest approach is at about 180000 light years
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at this distance or beyond the orbits of most halo objects would be disrupted by the magellanic clouds and the objects would likely be ejected from the vicinity of the milky way
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the galactic disc which bulges outward at the galactic center has a diameter of 70 100000 light years
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the exact distance from the sun to the galactic center is debated
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the latest estimates give distances to the galactic center of 25 28000 light years
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: movement of material around the galactic center shows that it has a compact object of very large mass
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the intense radio source named sagittarius a* thought to mark the center of the milky way is now confirmed to be a supermassive black hole
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most galaxies are believed to have a supermassive black hole at their center
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the nature of the galaxy's bar is also actively debated with estimates for its half length and orientation spanning from 3300-16000 light years short or a long bar and 10 50 degrees
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: viewed from the andromeda galaxy it would be the brightest feature of our own galaxy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: mercury is the smallest planet in the solar system
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is the closest planet to the sun
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it makes one trip around the sun once every 87.969 days
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: mercury is bright when it is visible from earth ranging from −2.0 to 5.5 in apparent magnitude
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it cannot be easily seen as it is usually too close to the sun
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: because mercury is normally lost in the glare of the sun except during a solar eclipse mercury can only be seen in the morning or evening twilight
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: compared to what is known about the other planets in the solar system little is known about mercury
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: telescopes on the earth show only a small bright crescent and putting a satellite in orbit around it is difficult
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the first of two spacecraft to visit the planet was mariner 10 which mapped only about 45% of the planet's surface from 1974 to 1975
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the second is the messenger spacecraft which finished mapping the planet in march 2013
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: mercury looks a lot like earth's moon
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it has many craters with areas of smooth plains no moons around it and no atmosphere as we know it
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however mercury does have an extremely thin atmosphere known as an exosphere
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: unlike earth's moon mercury has a large iron core which gives off a magnetic field about 1% as strong as that of the earth
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is a very dense planet due to the large size of its core
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: surface temperatures can be anywhere from about 90 to 700 k −183 °c to 427 °c −297 °f to 801 °f with the subsolar point being the hottest and the bottoms of craters near the poles being the coldest
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: known sightings of mercury date back to at least the first millennium bc before the 4th century bc greek astronomers thought that mercury was two different objects one able to be seen only at sunrise which they called apollo the other that was only able to be seen at sunset which they called hermes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the english name for the planet is from the romans who named it after the roman god mercury which they thought to be the same as the greek god hermes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the symbol for mercury is based on hermes staff
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: even though mercury is the closest planet to the sun it is not the warmest
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is because it has no greenhouse effect so any heat that the sun gives to it quickly escapes into space
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: mercury is one of four inner planets in the solar system and has a rocky body like the earth
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is the smallest planet in the solar system with a radius of
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: mercury is even smaller than some of the largest moons in the solar system such as ganymede and titan
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however it has a greater mass than the largest moons in the solar system
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: mercury is made of about 70% metallic and 30% silicate material
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: mercury's density is the second highest in the solar system at 5.427 g cm³ only a little bit less than earth's

lines.value: an ion is an electrically charged atom or group of atoms
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is a part of an atom or part of a group of atoms molecule
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is charged so it will move near electricity
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is because atoms are made of three smaller parts the charge on a proton is measured as +1 positively charged
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the charge on an electron is measured as -1 negatively charged
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: an atom that is ionized makes two ions one positive and one negatively charged
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for example a neutral hydrogen atom has one proton and one electron
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: heating the atom breaks it into two parts 1 a positively charged hydrogen ion h+ 2 a negatively charged electron
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a liquid with ions is called an electrolyte
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a gas with lots of ions is called a plasma
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when ions move it is called electricity
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for example in a wire the metal ions do not move but the electrons move as electricity
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a positive ion and a negative ion will move together
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: two ions of the same charge will move apart
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when ions move they also make magnetic fields
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many ions are colourless
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: elements in the main groups in the periodic table form colourless ions
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some ions are coloured
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the transition metals usually form coloured ions

lines.value: negative ions are called anions

lines.value: they are attracted to anodes positively charged electrodes

lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most ions have a charge of less than 4 but some can have higher charges

lines.value: kofi annan born 8 april 1938 is a ghanaian diplomat
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he served as the seventh secretary general of the united nations from 1 january 1997 to 31 december 2006
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: annan and the united nations were the co recipients of the 2001 nobel peace prize
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they were awarded the prize for their work for a better organized and more peaceful world
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: annan was born in kumasi ghana to an elite family
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his parents henry reginald and victoria annan are from the two major ethnic groups that make up the akan - one of the groups of indigenous people of ghana
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his father was half asante and half fante his mother was fante
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the asante were gold merchants while the fante tribe were the middlemen in the gold trade between the asante and the british
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: annan whose first name means born on a friday also had a twin sister who died in 1991 from a still yet unknown disease
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in ghanaian culture twins are considered special and are adored
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: annan probably got his first lessons in politics and diplomacy early on from his family
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: both of annan's grandfathers and his uncle were tribal chiefs
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: upon his retirement annan's father who worked as an export manager for the cocoa exporter lever brothers was elected governor of ghana's asante province
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1954 annan attended mfantsipim school an methodist boarding school in central ghana
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the secretary general says that the school taught him that suffering anywhere concerns people everywhere
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: annan went to macalaster college in st paul minnesota and graduating in 1961
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was a sloan fellow at mit in 1971 72 getting a master's degree in management
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: annan became secretary general of the united nations in january 1997 succeeding boutros boutros ghali of egypt
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: annan was a un veteran who took his first job with the organization in 1962 and worked his way up through various posts including deputy director to the un high commissioner for refugees 1980-83 and head of the u.n.'s peacekeeping efforts 1995-96
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: annan was the first secretary general chosen from the ranks of the u.n.'s staff
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he is also the first black man to hold the post and the second african after boutros ghali
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his second term began in 2002 and ran through the end of 2006
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 2001 he and the united nations were awarded the nobel peace prize for their work for a better organized and more peaceful world
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: annan is married to nane annan a lawyer and artist from sweden
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: mr annan also had a loyal friend who was his son's kojo chaffuffer and confidant john miller mr miller
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: emergency medicine is a specialty of medicine
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a specialty is a special part of medicine where a doctor may have more knowledge
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: examples are pediatrics doctors who care for children geriatrics doctors who care for elderly people and cardiology doctors who know more about the heart emergency medicine abbreviation em is sometimes also called accident and emergency medicine aem
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: em doctors specialize in treating diseases and injuries that need immediate care
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these kind of diseases or injuries are called emergencies
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if they are not helped quickly the person may become more sick or even die
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: doctors that specialize in em usually work in emergency departments

lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these are places in hospitals where people go if they have an emergency
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they may have a red cross or red letters on the sign to show it is the emergency department
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this way even people who cannot read know where to go.doctors who specialize in em must know some about all of the different specialties of medicine
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they treat people of all ages

lines.value: they treat both men and women
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they must know how to treat any kind of emergency
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: but they may not know quite as much about the chronic treatments of diseases over years
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however many people come to the emergency department with problems that are not emergencies
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: so em doctors must also know about how to treat non emergencies

lines.value: in 2006 they became their own countries

lines.value: it was on the west central balkan peninsula next bosnia and herzegovina and croatia on the western sides hungary to the north romania and bulgaria to the east the republic of macedonia to the south and albania to the southwest with just over 200 km of coast on the adriatic

lines.value: serbia and montenegro worked together in only some political areas

lines.value: the states had separate economic policies and currencies money

lines.value: although both the states now had more freedom to do as they pleased then they did as federal republic of yugoslavia serbia and montenegro was still a sovereign state united under one government

lines.value: a plebiscite or referendum is a type of voting or of proposing laws
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some definitions of plebiscite suggest that it is a type of vote to change the constitution or government of a country
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: others define it as the opposite
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: australia defines referendum as a vote to change the constitution and plebiscite as a vote that does not affect the constitution
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are two types of result in the united kingdom referenda have only been advisory because the government says that the people elected to parliament make the decisions
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the referendum on the independence of scotland was an exception
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was legally binding but it was not a referendum of the uk electorate
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was restricted to present residents of scotland
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: an example of a proposed plebiscite was the 2011 decision by greek prime minister george papandreou to let the greek people vote on whether the heavily indebted nation would accept a €130 billion bailout package from the european union
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the idea shocked eurozone nations as a no vote could mean greece defaulting on its national debt and leaving the european union and the eurozone
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however the vote was cancelled
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: another example was the voting on the european constitution in 2005
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the vote took place in some countries
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: france and the netherlands had a referendum on the subject
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in both states the voters said no to the proposal and no constitution was made
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the separate simultaneous referendums held on 24 april 2004 in the turkish republic of northern cyprus and the republic of cyprus on the comprehensive settlement plan of the un secretary general provides yet another example of such a vote
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the plan was approved in the turkish cypriot referendum by 65% while it was rejected in the greek cypriot referendum by 75%
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many political problems can be solved by asking the people their opinion because the supporters of the argument will be forced to accept the decision of the people
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however it is feared that the electorate do not have sufficient political knowledge to truly understand what they are voting for philosophers plato and madison thought voters are too easily persuaded by their own internal feelings of a matter instead of focusing on the good of the nation
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: that is to say they vote selfishly
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: fyodor ivanovich tyutchev rus фeaop nbahobny tюtyeb fyo'dər eva'nəvich tyu'chif december 5 1803 - july 27 1873 was one of the most significant russian poets
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: almost 20 years of his life he spent in munich and turin
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: tyutchev was a good friend of heinrich heine knew schelling as well
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: tyutchev didn't want people to know him as a poet
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he didn't take any part in a literary life
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: we know about 400 of his poems
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: russian people quote them very often
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his early poems are made in russian poetic tradition of the xviii century
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the 1830s we can find an influence of european especially german romanticism on tyutchev's lyrics
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he writes philosophic poems about the universe nature and human being
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1840s tyutchev wrote several articles about relations between russia and occidental civilization
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1850s tyutchev created several heartfelt poems in which we can see love as a tragedy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these poems are combined into one cycle named denisievsky
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: denisievsky means dedicated to a mistress of tyutchev - elena alexandrovna denisieva
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1860s-1870s tyutchev wrote mainly political poems
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the most famous tyutchev's poem is silentium
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is a hard appeal to be silent
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: because a man never can understand another person
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: death valley is a valley in the us state of california

lines.value: death valley was covered by a lake that was named lake manly by geologists scientists who study the earth
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: lake manly used to be very large but changes in the weather caused the rivers that brought water into the lake to dry up
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after a long time the water in lake manly began to dry up too

lines.value: dr robert sharp a geology professor decided to find out about these rocks

lines.value: twenty eight of the stones did indeed move sometimes more than

lines.value: even though death valley gets less than two inches of rain a year the raindrops make the smooth clay in the dry lake bed very smooth and slippery

lines.value: the wind then blows the rocks across the slippery surface sometimes as fast as every second

lines.value: in this style of writing the music was thought to be more important than the words

lines.value: this meant that the music could be very contrapuntal with several things going on at once so that the words could not be clearly heard

lines.value: however in the seconda pratica the words were more important than the music i.e it was important to be able to hear all the words clearly and the music had to be simple enough for this to happen

lines.value: this was particularly important in opera and in madrigals
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: boudica born about 25 ad died 60/61 ad was the queen of the celtic iceni people in norfolk in the eastern part of roman britain
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a statue of boudica was put up in the westminster area of london in 1902
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: her husband prasutagus ruled an independent client state of rome
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when he died he left his kingdom jointly to his daughters and the roman emperor
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was normal roman practice to allow allied kingdoms their independence only for the lifetime of their client king
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for example the provinces of bithynia and galatia were made part of the empire in just this way
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: also roman law allowed inheritance only through the male line
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when prasutagus died his will was ignored by the governor gaius suetonius paulinus and his kingdom was annexed just as if it had been conquered
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: to make matters worse roman money lenders called in the debts which prasutagus had borrowed during his life
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the lands and property of the iceni were confiscated and their nobles treated like slaves
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when boudica protested paulinus had her flogged and her two daughters raped in public
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: tacitus reports

lines.value: choosing a good moment when the governor was attacking anglesey and another legion was in bristol boudica led the iceni and their associates the trinovantes to war

lines.value: they destroyed camulodunum modern colchester and moved towards londinium
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there was only the 9th legion legio ix hispana to defend it
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the tribes burnt and destroyed both verulamium st albans and londinium and massacred all they could lay their hands on
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: an estimated 70000-80000 romans and british were killed in the three cities by those led by boudica
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the final battle took place near watling street in the english midlands
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: watling street was an old trackway between canterbury and st albans
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the romans rebuilt it their way and took it through the midlands into wales
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: while boudica's army assaulted in verulamium suetonius put together a force with his own legio xiv gemina some detachments of the legio xx valeria victrix and any available auxiliaries
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: down near exeter the prefect of legio ii augusta poenius postumus ignored the governor's call to arms
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: nonetheless the governor was able to call on almost ten thousand men
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the romans were heavily outnumbered

lines.value: however the tribes lacked manoeuvrability
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they had no way to direct these numbers which put them at a disadvantage to the romans
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the romans were skilled at open combat and had better equipment and discipline
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: also the narrowness of the field meant that boudica could put forth only as many troops as the romans at any given time

lines.value: first the romans stood their ground and used volleys of pila heavy javelins to kill thousands of britons who rushed toward the roman lines

lines.value: the roman soldiers engaged boudica's second wave in the open
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as the romans advanced in a wedge formation the britons attempted to flee but were impeded by the presence of their own families

lines.value: they had put their people in wagons at the edge of the battlefield and were slaughtered

lines.value: tacitus reports that according to one report almost eighty thousand britons fell compared with only four hundred romans

lines.value: boudica fled and her time and place of death is not known

lines.value: microraptor was a small feathered dinosaur related to velociraptor
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it had flight feathers and could glide and probably fly
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: about two dozen well preserved fossil specimens have been found in liaoning china
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they are from the lower cretaceous jiufotang formation 125 million years old
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: adult specimens are 42 83 centimeters 1.4-2.7 ft long so microraptor was one of the smallest dinosaurs
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: microraptor is one of a number of dinobirds found in the same area of china
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they were buried in volcanic ash during huge eruptions
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: :"the evolution of powered flight in birds from theropod dinosaurs is recognized as the key adaptive breakthrough that contributed to the biological success of this group hundreds of small exquisitely preserved feathered theropods were discovered in the early cretaceous jehol group of northeastern china as they died some 125 million years ago smothered in the cretaceous pompeii both anatomy and phylogeny strongly suggest that these theropods offer new insights into the origins of feathers and flight favoring the arboreal trees-down over the cursorial ground-up hypothesis
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: microraptor was among the first non avian dinosaurs discovered with the impressions of feathers and wings
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: three specimens of m
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: zhaoianus have been described in detail in addition to two specimens of m gui and three specimens of m sp described by xu and colleagues in 2003 from which most feather impressions are known
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: unusual even among early birds and feathered dinosaurs microraptor is one of the few known bird precursors to sport long flight feathers on its feet as well as its forearms and hands
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this led xu xing to describe it as a four winged dinosaur and to speculate that it may have glided using all four limbs for lift
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: their bodies had a thick covering of feathers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a diamond shaped fan on the end of the tail gave stability during flight
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sankar chatterjee found that in order for microraptor to glide or fly the fore and hind wings must have been on different levels as on a biplane and not overlaid as on a dragonfly
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: using this biplane model he calculated possible methods of gliding and determined that microraptor most likely launched itself from a perch swooped downward in a deep u shaped curve and then lifted again to land on another tree
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the feathers not directly employed in the biplane wing like those on the tibia and the tail could have been used to control and alter the flight path
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the hind wings would also have helped control the gliding flight
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: chatterjee also used computer algorithms to test whether or not microraptor was capable of true powered flight in addition to gliding
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the data showed that microraptor could sustain some level powered flight so it is possible that the animal flew as well as glided
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some countries elect their monarch instead of using inheritance like the holy roman empire and malaysia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the wife of a king is also called a queen
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however the husband of a female ruler is not necessarily called a king
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the last king of britain george vi had a wife elizabeth who was called queen elizabeth
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he had no sons so he was followed by his elder daughter
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she is also called elizabeth and became queen elizabeth ii
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she is married to the duke of edinburgh but when she became queen he did not become king
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many people do not think it is good to have a queen because she is not elected though most people in the uk want to keep the royal family
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a queen regnant is head of state and has all the powers of a sovereign
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a queen regnant does not keep the title of queen if she abdicates resigns
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: no queen has ever abdicated in the history of the united kingdom but two abdications have occurred in the kingdom of the netherlands
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a queen consort is the wife of a king
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she is not the head of state and does not have any powers unless they are given by the king or another law
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a queen dowager is the widow of a king
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a queen consort usually keeps the title of queen after her husband's death for example

lines.value: a houseplant is any kind of decorative plant

lines.value: people grow them indoors usually in a house where these plants gets their name

lines.value: athena is the greek goddess of wisdom and strategy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she is one of the twelve olympians
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: athena's symbol is the owl the wisest of the birds
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she also had a shield called aegis which was a given to her by zeus
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she is often shown with her helmet on and with her shield which has medusa's head on it
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this was a present to her from perseus
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: athena is the protector of athens greece a city named after her
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the parthenon which is on the acropolis in athens is her most famous temple
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she also helped many heroes including heracles jason and odysseus and is always seen with nike the goddess of victory
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are many stories about athena's birth
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in hesiod's theogony zeus had sexual intercourse with metis but zeus was scared of her giving birth to a child because the oracle of delphi had said that she will give birth to athena and a son that would overthrow zeus just like zeus overthrew cronus
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: to stop metis giving birth to her son zeus swallowed her whole
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this was when she turned herself into a fly as zeus and metis were playing a game
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however zeus was too late as metis was already pregnant
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: while she was inside zeus's head metis made a helmet armor and a robe for athena
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the hammering noise caused zeus to have a severe headache
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: to help zeus in pain ares cut his head open with a minoan axe
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: athena then came out of zeus's head
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she was fully grown and had her armor on
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: athena is the goddess of knowledge purity arts crafts learning justice and wisdom
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she also plays a tough clever and independent role
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: athenians thought she helped them win the trojan war
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: athena often helped hero es especially ones who were not just brave but clever like jason and perseus
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: people joined her cult hoping she would give them victory
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: athena was given many other titles
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she has the epithet ergane as the patron of craftsmen and artisans
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: with the epithet parthenos she was especially worshipped in the festivals of the panathenaea and pamboeotia where both militaristic and athletic displays took place
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: with the epithet promachos she led in battle
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: with the epithet polias athena was the protector of not only athens but also of many other cities including argos sparta gortyn lindos and larisa

lines.value: powder is very small dry pieces or grains
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when we press some dry solids very hard or when we cut something up into lots of small pieces we can sometimes make powder
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for example people sometimes put face powder on their faces when they want to look good
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sometimes sports players put powder on their hands to make them dry
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: we put curry powder in our food to make it taste stronger
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: we put washing powder in the washing machine when we want to have clean clothes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: people use gunpowder to make bombs and fireworks
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: to powder is also a verb mary powdered her face
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when a person says i am going to powder my nose they usually mean that they are going to use the toilet us english use the bathroom

lines.value: the fictional characters the x men are a team of superheroes who were born with special mutant powers making them different from regular humans
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the x men characters are owned by marvel comics which publishes comic books featuring them as well as many other superheroes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the comic book was one of the first to combine social issues and commentary into a superhero story set in a world where people with mutant abilities are hated by those born without them
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is similar to acts of ableism seen throughout history
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: unlike some mutants the x men try to be good and show tolerance toward humans and other mutants
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the idea behind the superheroes were inspired by the african american equality supporters like malcolm x and martin luther king
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the original x men as created by writer stan lee and jack kirby were and all first appeared in x men 1 sept 1963
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the leader and mentor of the x men is professor charles xavier who is more commonly known as professor x and has mental powers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he wants to gain civil rights for mutants in the way that martin luther king did for african americans through peace
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some other well known x men include some of the x men's enemies include magneto mystique sabretooth toad juggernaut mister sinister and apocalypse
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the leader of x men's enemies is magneto
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he wants to gain civil rights for mutants in the forceful style of malcolm x
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the x men characters have since been featured in various comic book series motion pictures toys animated series and much more
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: linus benedict torvalds is a computer scientist born december 28 1969 in helsinki finland
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his parents named him after linus pauling
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he studied at the university of helsinki from 1988 to 1996
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he became famous because of the success of his operating system linux
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he started making this system as a student project in 1991
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he based it on the popular unix operating system
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: today linux has become the most popular free operating system
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: linus is the leader of the linux project which has many members around the world
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he is the one person who can make decisions about changes or future development on the operating system
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he also made the revision control system git
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he now lives with his family in the united states
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: linus chose the penguin to be the logo of linux
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a picture of penguin appears on many desktop computers that run linux
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: vancouver is a coastal city and major seaport on the mainland of southwestern british columbia canada
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the city has a population of over 630000
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is the largest city in british columbia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: metro vancouver has a population of over 2 million people
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: that makes it the third largest metropolitan area in canada
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: vancouver has a mix of people from different cultures
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: fifty two percent of city residents have a first language that is not english
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: native people began living in this area around 10000-8000 years ago
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these people were part of three main groups the squamish musqueam and tsleil waututh
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: vancouver was founded in 1886 and is named after british naval captain george vancouver
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: captain vancouver explored the area around vancouver and vancouver island in the 1790s
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the university of british columbia is in vancouver
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: vancouver also has stanley park which has beaches and totem poles
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: nearby is grouse mountain which has good skiing and has a 2.9 km 1.8 mi hiking trail which is known as the grouse grind
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: grouse mountain also has an animal sanctuary including wolves and bears
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the lions gate bridge is in vancouver
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: vancouver has two ice hockey teams the vancouver canucks who play for the national hockey league and the vancouver giants who play for the western hockey league
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the bc lions of the canadian football league are based in vancouver
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the team has won 6 grey cups
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in soccer vancouver is home to the vancouver whitecaps fc
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the 2010 winter olympics were held in vancouver and it was the first time canada won a gold medal on canadian soil
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: vancouver is on a peninsula on the west coast of canada less than a one hour drive north of the canada us border
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: between vancouver and the pacific ocean to the west is a large island called vancouver island
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: until the city was named in 1885 vancouver referred to vancouver island
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some people mistakenly think that the city is on vancouver island
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on the south shore of vancouver is the fraser river which flows west into the strait of georgia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the water along the north shore is called burrard inlet
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the city has an area of 114 square kilometres 44 sq mi
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the larger metropolitan area is 2878 square kilometres 1111 sq mi
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as with most of british columbia vancouver is in the pacific time zone utc−8
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: vancouver has a warm summer mediterranean climate csb in the koppen climate classification
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the average annual rainfall is 1155 mm mostly from october to april
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: high temperatures in the summer average 22 °c
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the highest temperature ever recorded was 34.4 °c on july 30 2009
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on average snow falls on only 11 days per year
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the snow is usually wet not very deep and melts in the rain
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on average on only 4.5 days a year does the temperature not rise above freezing
lines.name: Simple English
