lines.value: costa rica officially called republic of costa rica is a country in central america
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is bordered by nicaragua to the north panama to the southeast the pacific ocean to the west and the caribbean sea to the east
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the official language of costa rica is spanish
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the official currency is the colon
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it has enjoyed a long period of peace since the 1948 civil war
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: because of its natural beauty and political stability it is nicknamed the switzerland of latin america
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: costa rica has had no army since december 1 1948
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: instead of spending money on the military the government spends money on education and health
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: 4301712 people live in costa rica
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the capital city is san jose
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the current president is luis guillermo solis
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was elected in 2014
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the indigenous people of costa rica belong to the intermediate area
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this intermediate area is where the mesoamerican and andean indigenous cultures mixed together
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the country was influenced by various chibcha speaking indigenous people
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the impact of indigenous peoples culture on modern costa rica has been small
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the country did not have a strong native civilization to begin with
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most of the indigenous population was absorbed into the spanish colony
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are still some small indigenous groups
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the largest is the bribri and boruca tribes in south costa rica
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: christopher columbus sailed to the eastern shores of costa rica during his last trip in 1502
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he reported large amounts of gold jewelry among the indigenous people
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: during the colonial period costa rica was the most southern province of the captaincy general of guatemala
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: but it mostly ruled itself as a part of the spanish empire
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: costa rica's distance from the capital in guatemala its legal prohibition to trade with the viceroyalty of new granada and the lack of gold and silver made costa rica into a poor little populated region of the spanish empire
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: costa rica was called the poorest and most miserable spanish colony in all america by a spanish governor in 1719
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: costa rica's poverty was also because there were not enough indigenous people available for slavery
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most of the costa rican settlers had to work on their own land
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there were no large haciendas plantations
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for all these reasons costa rica was unappreciated and forgotten by the spanish crown
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it had to develop on its own
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: costa rica became a rural democracy with no oppressed mestizo or indigenous class
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was not long before spanish settlers turned to the hills where they found rich volcanic soil and a better climate
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: costa rica never fought for independence from spain
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on september 15 1821 after the last spanish defeat in the mexican war of independence 1810-21 the authorities in guatemala declared the independence of all of central america
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: that date is still celebrated as independence day in costa rica
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: costa rica joined the first mexican empire of agustin de iturbide
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after its collapse in 1823 costa rica became a province of the new federal republic of central america
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it existed from 1823 to 1839
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it had a very loose authority over its provinces especially the poor and remote costa rica
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1824 the costa rican capital was moved to san jose
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this led to a brief battle with the old capital cartago
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: while civil wars were common in the federal republic of central america costa rica was largely peaceful
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1838 costa rica formally proclaimed itself an independent country
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the local population had little allegiance to the federal government in guatemala
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: from colonial times to now costa rica's reluctance to become politically tied with the rest of central america has been a major obstacle to efforts for greater regional integration
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: coffee was first planted in costa rica in the early 19th century
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was first shipped to europe in 1843
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it became costa rica's first major export
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: coffee would remain costa rica's biggest export until the 20th century
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most of the coffee exported was transported by oxcart to the pacific port of puntarenas
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: since the main market for the coffee was in europe it soon became a high priority to develop a transportation route from the central plateau to the atlantic ocean
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for this purpose in the 1870s the costa rican government asked us businessman minor c keith to build a railroad to the caribbean port of limon
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: despite enormous difficulties with construction disease and financing the railroad was completed in 1890
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most afro costa ricans come from jamaican immigrants who worked on the railway
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: united states convicts italians and chinese immigrants also worked in the construction of the railroad
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in exchange for making the railroad costa rican gave keith large amounts of land and a lease on the train route which he used to produce bananas and export them to the united states
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as a result bananas became the largest export
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the united fruit company began to hold a major role in the national economy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: costa rica has enjoyed greater peace and political stability than other latin american nations
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: but in 1917 19 general federico tinoco granados ruled as a military dictator until he was overthrown
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the unpopularity of tinoco's government led to a considerable decline in the size wealth and political influence of the costa rican military
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1948 jose figueres ferrer led an armed uprising between the previous president rafael angel calderon guardia he served as president between 1940 and 1944 and otilio ulate blanco
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: with more than 2000 dead the 44-day costa rican civil war was the bloodiest event in costa rica during the 20th century
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the victorious rebels formed a government that abolished the military
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it oversaw the drafting of a new constitution by a democratically elected assembly
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: having enacted these reforms the junta relinquished its power on november 8 1949 to the new democratic government
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after that figueres became a national hero winning the country's first democratic election under the new constitution in 1953
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: since then costa rica has held 14 presidential elections the latest in 2014
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: all of them have been widely regarded by the international community as peaceful and transparent
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: costa rica is on the central american isthmus
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is between latitudes 8° and 12°n and longitudes 82° and 86°w
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it borders the caribbean sea to the east and the pacific ocean to the west
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it has a total of of coastline
lines.name: Simple English
